loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady S. est vendeuse de poissons dans son quartier a camberene.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999 et capitalise une experience de cinq(5)ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond accroitre ses benefices car c'est une dame qui contribue beaucoup a l'entretien de sa famille grace a son commerce.
texts.en:
Khady S. is a retailer of fish in her area in Camberene. She has been a parent beneficiary since 1999 and has capitalized on 5 years of experience in her business. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA to increase her capital in order to increase her profits, because she is a lady who contributes significantly to supporting her family thanks to her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol M. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Carol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In May 2009, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carol is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: P. Habib lives with his family in Istaravshan town. Through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of grapes. He tends to his crop himself, with the help of his son. One of Habib’s biggest problems is the harvesting of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income which he uses to support his family. Habib has asked for a loan of 2,500 USD that will be used for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old and owns a retail kiosk in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Felix has been in this business for 5 years. He has requested his second loan of Ksh. 60,000 to increase his stock of flour, soda, rice and start selling cereals after successfully completing a first loan of Ksh. 30,000. He would like to own two supermarkets away from the slums one day.  He desires to educate his children to the highest level and buy his family a home and real estate investment away from Mukuru slums. Felix describes himself as hardworking and industrious. 


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco N. is 42 years old. He is married and has four children.

Jean Bosco has ten years experience in selling various products such as those shown in the photo. With his three previous loans, Jean Bosco was able to create four jobs for four people. He needs his fourth loan to expand his business through purchasing more products in order to earn more profits.

Now, as Jean Bosco is getting many clients, he wants to create more jobs by expanding his business. With that expansion, he hopes to earn more profits. With his larger profits, he plans to pay school fees for his children and save for their future.

loans.use: To expand his business through purchasing more products

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a 50-year-old married woman with three children ranging in ages from school-age to young adult. The M. family lives in Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Nenita tells us that although she has been running her carinderia (luncheonette) for the past ten years, it was not until she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago that she was able to expand and improve her business, making the carinderia lucrative enough to support her family and to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

Now on her fourteenth loan cycle, Nenita is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can offer a wider variety of food to her customers and earn enough to support her family and to continue to be able to pay tuition fees.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To be able to offer a wider variety of food at her luncheonette business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a member of the utulivu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 10 years.she also cares for other 6 dependents.

Aziza started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Aziza`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Aziza hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel T. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Maribel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel runs a sari-sari, which is a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old and sells second-hand shoes in the Gikomba market of Nairobi. Richard has been in this business for 4 years, and previously worked as a shoe shiner.  He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase his stock of shoes. He would like to become an importer one day.  In the future, he would like to educate his children and buy his family a home. Richard describes himself as social and determined. 



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion J., age 52, is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan Bukidnon. Presentacion is widowed and has eight grown children. To make a living, Presentacion runs a sari-sari, which is a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid one previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and to pay debts.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nodirbek

texts.en:
A. Nodirbek is an energetic young man who tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Nodirbek started his business six years ago. He is carrying on the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Nodirbek has great experience in cattle breeding because he has observed the process since childhood.

Nodirbek would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase income and improve his family's living conditions.

We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. habite a camberene et evolue dans le commerce depuis 1994 principalement dans la vente d'articles de mercerie,associee a celle de fripperie.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000) pour augmenter son fond afin de gagner d'autres marches et ainsi accroitre ses benefices.par consequent elle pourra mieux soutenir sa famille et ameliorer leur niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Fatou N. lives in Camberene and has developed a business since 1994 that primarily sells dressmaking supplies, combined with a used clothing business. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her funds in order to gain additional markets and thus increase her profits. In this way, she will be able to better support her family and improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
B. Azimjon, age 26, runs a cafe where he offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner. When he first started his business, he could only open the cafe to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular, he was able to dedicate all his time to the business.

Azimjon is requesting a loan so that he may invest in an oven and a refrigerator. He is asking for $1,000 for this purpose. With this money, Azimjon will be able to expand his business and earn more of a profit, thus allowing him to help his family move forward.

The well-being of this family is in your hands. They are grateful for your contribution to the growth of Azimjon’s business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma M. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Norma owns and operates a clothing business, providing "ukay-ukay" or used general clothing to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: Tajik housewives are usually also active in helping their husbands by earning more income. There are many occupations that were traditionally male dominated but are now done by women. Dilfuza’s is an example. Dilfuza has been farming cattle for the past five years. Her earnings even surpassed her husband's who works as a farmer. Dilfuza, with the support of her daughter (pictured), is doing well in her business. With a loan from IMON International she expects to buy young cattle. She really hopes that she can produce more cows to be sold so she earns more than last year. loans.name: Kuzimurod

texts.en:
I. Kuzimurod is a very responsible and optimistic person. He supports his wife and children by raising cattle in hs village. Kuzimurod wishes to develop his business because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers, especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Kuzimurod is helped in his business by his wife.

He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing: accordingly, their expenses are growing, too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in his business. With the loan he has requested, he wishes to buy calves to raise.

We hope that his capabilities combined with the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business and help his family.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 32 year old father of three who offers M-pesa services (money transfer) and supplies eggs in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Evans has been in this business for 2 years, and previously  worked as a mason. He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase his M-pesa cash float. He would like to start rearing chicken and become a full M-pesa agent.  He describes himself as faithful, hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Increase Cash float on money transfer

loans.name: Furkatjon

texts.en:
Furkatjon is the responsible father of two children. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity which was passed down from his parents and which today brings him satisfaction.

He also runs a business of selling cattle fodder. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good profits from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Furkatjon hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.name: Majit

texts.en:
L. Majit, age 47, supports his wife and child by selling cattle. As a rule, Majit purchases calves in the central market, raises them, and then sells them for higher prices in the local market. After having worked in this business for ten years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them, and how to take care of them. He gets up early every morning in order to feed and look after the animals.

His knowledge and skills have allowed him to make his business successful and to generate a stable income for his large family. Majit plans to enlarge his stock and to purchase the cattle. With this purpose he requests 3,000 Somoni, which he will spend on the purchase of two young cattle.

You could become an important part of Majit's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.name: Mukhlisa

texts.en:
M. Mukhlisa is 19 years. She is married and has been running the business of cattle raising for 4 years. The business income allows her to be able to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her husband take part in the farm work and help Mukhlisa pour water and cut grass for the animals. Mukhlisa has been delighted with the recent growth in her cattle farm and is enthusiastic about investing further. She is seeking a loan to buy more young cattle for expanding her business and with that way to earn more.

loans.name: Mukhbira

texts.en:
M. Mukhbira sells groceries such as tinned products, sweets, soft drinks and others. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Mukhbira has been selling groceries since 2006. She is responsible for paying food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase her grocery inventory in her store. Mukhbira hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Sustaining a business is not easy, but Mrs. Lucita S. is willing to put all her energies to securing the future of her children.

Lucita S. is 62 years old and is married with six grown children. She lives in Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She grows a variety of vegetables which she also sells in the market, and this earns her about PHP 5,000 per month.

Lucita tells us that when NWTF-Project Dungganon started in their community, she joined without hesitation. She says that being part of the project has been enjoyable and interesting because she has learned how to appreciate what life is all about as an independent businesswoman. She also appreciates the camaraderie and support that Project Dungganon has provided her through what she describes as the almost rollercoaster ride of her life. She is thankful for the encouragement she has received to continue improving her business because it has motivated her to strive harder toward specific goals. For example, the income from her business has allowed her to start making improvements to her house, which she plans to continue with the income she earns as a result of taking out this new loan.

Lucita is borrowing PHP 7,000. This will be her twelfth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her goal is to sustain her business operations.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to sustain her business

loans.name: Rafickjon

texts.en:
Since 1999, Rafickjon has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows, and sheep. He is married and has three children whom he supports. He wants to continue to be able to give them a proper education. 

Rafickjon has improved his financial situation since his father was also a cattle breeder, so he has gained rich experience in the livestock business since childhood. Today, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer dairy products in his community and surrounding areas. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. 

Rafickjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.  

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Erkinboy

texts.en: S. Erkinboy is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Erkinboy is an animal farmer. He owns cows and sells their milk together with the help of his wife and elder son. In order to further develop his business, Erkinboy wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more cows and feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then, he will be able to use the profits from his business for the well-being of his family. loans.use: To buy one or two more cows and feed for them

loans.name: Artin

texts.en:
Artin is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a home painter since 1995 and has twenty years of experience in this field.

Today, Artin is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Tulkinboy

texts.en:
Married and father of two children, Tulkinboy was born on Mrch 31, 1969. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Tulkinboy has been selling cattle since 2004. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today Tulkinboy would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle. Tulkinboy has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mame Khardiata

texts.fr: mame khardiata N. vend du couscous et du mil depuis dans son quartier a camberene depuis 1995.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1998 et a travers son activite de commerce elleparticipe beaucoup a l'entretien de sa famille.par consequent elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond.
texts.en:
Mame Khardiata N. has been selling couscous and millets in her area of Camberene since 1995. She has been a parent beneficiary since 1998, and through her business activity, participates significantly in supporting her family. As a result, she is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is a 25-year-old single man. He has owned a hunting-equipment shop since 2004 to earn income to achieve better living conditions. Today, Marwan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase special clothes to increase his sales and also his income.

loans.use: Purchase special clothes

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana C. is 43 years old and married with four children. She resides in Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago so that she could have an independent income to support her family. She started selling plastic ware in her community, which she later expanded to other locations by renting a "papag" (or a table in the market) so that she could also hawk her wares to other communities.

Now her business is a family affair because they have seen that it has greatly improved their living conditions and enables her to pay the tuition fees of her children. She intends to use the income from this PHP 7,000 loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to pay the upcoming tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 62-year-old married man and father of four children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1970 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. After this long experience, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a new car in order to continue his work.

loans.use: Buy a new car

loans.name: Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 26 years.

Mariam started her own food business selling fish 20 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 280,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mariam`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mariam hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Nuru is also the member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  For the past 30 years, he has been working as a fisherman. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Hussein is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools for his work.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver S. is a young man and is 23 years old. He is single, and lives with his parents. 

With this new loan for his business of 500,000 RWF he will be able to buy more merchandise for his shop. The profits from this loan will allow him to get married, changing his life forever. He will also save money so that he will be able to buy his own house.

Silver has five years experience in his business and works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. He is excited to see how this new loan will impact his community.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old single man.  Since 2007, he has been working in design and construction with his father to provide for the family's needs. Today, Abbas is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy wood for the business.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Tayepsu Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Tayepsu Group. They are small-scale businessmen based in the town of Waterloo. They have been in business for many years now but their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace. With the opening of a new branch in Waterloo of SMT, in partnership with Kiva partner Shine on Sierra Leone, they are seeking a loan in order to improve their businesses. With LE 500,000 each, they will be able to expand their businesses in order to make larger profits and consequently improve their standard of living.

Foday K. (in the middle of the group photo and in the small photo on the left) is the leader of this group. Foday is twenty-eight years of age. He was born in Waterloo, is married to a nurse and they have two children. One of their children is in class four and the other in class one. As you can see from the small photo, Foday sells bags, wall clocks, radios, cassette recorders, and mobile phone accessories. He has been in this business for ten years.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2006, he decided to open his own business as a builder and began a new career. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy an electric machine specialized for his job in order to facilitate his work.

loans.use: Buy an electric machine

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: khary W. habite dans le quartier de camberene mais exerce son activite de vente de fleurs en ville au marche kermel.elle capitalise une experience de seize ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son fond et ainsi repondre a la demande croissante de sa clientele.avec l'accroissement de ses benefices elle parvient a miux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Khary W. lives in the Camberene area but runs a business selling flowers in the city, at the Kermel market. She has capitalized on sixteen years of experience in her business. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA to strengthen her capital and thus respond to the increasing demands of her clientele. With the increase in her profits, she will be able to better help her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a mother of two children working as a home-based clothes seller to cooperate with her husband on the household expenses and to be able to continue her children's schooling. Hayat is requesting to borrow $600 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore, her income.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 41-year-old married man with three children. He has owned a mini-market since 2007 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. Abdallah is requesting to borrow $500 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore, his income.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working as a cook on demand since 2004 with a previous 15 years of experience in this field. Therese is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more ingredients so she can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase her income.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients

loans.name: Kolawole

texts.en: Kolawole is 37 years old and married with four children. She has a shop where she rents video compact discs. She wants to add foodstuffs to sell in her shop. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rouwayda

texts.en: Rouwayda is a 39-year-old married women living with her husband and three young children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 1999 and has 20 years of experience in this field. Today, Rouwayda is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional textiles so she can satisfy the heavy demands of her clientele and help increase her income.

loans.use: Buy additional textiles

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Mrs. Nelly M. of Purok Gumamela, Busay, Bago City, Negros Occidental, is fearless when it comes to starting new business ventures, and she has proven to be one astute business woman. At 51, and married with four adult children, she strives hard to make all her business ventures lucrative so that she can provide a bright future for her children. Nelly started with only one small "sari-sari" or general store attached to her house. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she decided to use the money she borrowed to sell fish in her community. Later, she added a small cafeteria beside her general store. The reason why she diversified her business was because of the growing number of "sari-sari" or general stores being set up in their community competing with her own business. With her various ventures, Nelly feels more financially stable, and offering more to her customers has actually given her an edge over her competitors. Now she wants to borrow PHP 15,000 for her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to use as her rolling capital for her fish-selling business. She plans to use the income from this venture to pay for the tuition fees of her children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her community

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 19-year-old young man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to help his parents with his university fees by working at his university repairing computers. Jimmy is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy computer parts in order to develop his work and therefore, his income.

loans.use: Buy computer parts

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice W. is 49-years-old and married to Eli John. She has been operating the grocery business for the last four years. The clients grocery is in a highly populated area, therefore her groceries sell very fast thus she is able to get a good profit margin. She also manages some rental houses that she put up to boost her income.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. With the loan she has applied for she plans to increase her stock of groceries like potatoes, tomatoes, and cabbages. The extra profit that she will get will be used to build build more rental rooms in Kayole area.

Eunice believes she is hardworking and her future plans and dreams are to become a landlady earning over Ksh 100,000 in rent.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase her stock of groceries like potatoes, tomatoes, and cabbages.

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a beauty salon called "Signorita" since 2004 and has nine years of experience in this field. Thanks to her business income, she has been able, with her father, to meet the family needs.

Today, Nahida is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additionA. tools to better satisfy the demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She has been working as a tailor since 1994 to help her husband in the heavy household.

Today, Rajaa is requesting $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine in order to develop her work and so increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Babatunde

texts.en: Babatunde is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She is a stylist and also sell drinks. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extension, hair cream and drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extension, hair cream and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nachaat

texts.en: Nachaat is a 34-year-old single man. He has owned a car repair shop since 1994 to earn income to help satisfy his needs. With this long experience, Nachaat is requesting to borrow $1,000 to renovate his tools in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: Renovate his tools

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
A natural entrepreneur with her finger in many pies.

At 54, Angelica B. is married with 3 adult-age children and lives in Purok Paghidaet, Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Deciding to follow in her parents' footsteps, Angelica and her husband started a piggery business as their main source of income. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, her husband encouraged her to venture in other businesses to supplement their income from the piggery.  With the loans she borrowed from NWTF-Project Dungganon over the last nine years, she has added other businesses like raising chickens and a "sari-sari", or general store, to her roster of business ventures.

Angelica admits that she has learned a lot from her membership in Project Dungganon, which continues to guide her how to improve her management skills and expand her business acumen.

For this particular loan of PHP 29,500, Angelica plans to purchase fertilizers and other goods to resell to her neighbors and the neighboring farms in her community.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of two young children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2002 in collaboration with her husband to provide better life conditions for the family. Today, Najwa is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a new sewing machine to be able to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Itidal

texts.en: Itidal is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor for the past 17 years to earn income to help satisfy the needs of her family. Today, Itidal is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a sewing machine in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a single man living with his parents. He has owned an air conditioner car repair shop since 2007. In order to develop his work and make it better, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additional tools needed for his work and that's how he plans to increase his income.

loans.use: Buy additional tools

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She sells baby things and she has been in the business since 1993. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more baby things to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Mbeugue

texts.fr: mbeugue H. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1994.elle evolue dans la commercialisation de fruits saisonniers(mangues mades)depuis plus de six ans et parvient a assister sa famille grace a l'evolution de son activite.par consequent elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour renforcer son fond et faire face aux exigences de la clientele.
texts.en:
Mbeugue H. has been a parent beneficiary since 1994. She has developed a business selling seasonal fruit (mangoes) for more than six years, and manages to help support her family thanks to the development of her activity. As a result, she is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to strengthen her capital base and meet the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Hane

texts.en: Hane is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of four children. Four months ago, she decided to open an accessories and clothes shop as her own business. Today, Hane is requesting $800 to purchase more clothes to satisfy the heavy demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 31-year-old married woman with one child. She has been running her home-based accessories business since 2003 to help her husband with the household expenses.

Today, Zeina is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Samuel Muraguri

texts.en:
Samuel Muraguri is 21 years old and single. He has been in the taxi-operation business for the last four years. The taxi operates in a suburban area that is also a highly populated business area. There are wholesale shops and customers use taxis to transport their goods.

He was introduced to KADET through existing clients. He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to buy new wheels for his car. With the extra profit, Samuel intends to buy another taxi to increase his income.

He believes he is hardworking and his hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: The client intends to buy new wheels for his taxi

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is 52 years old and married to Grace Wangechi. They are blessed with four children: one daughter and three sons. John and his family live in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he runs a business of key cutting and padlock repairs. He has been in the business for the last 14 years.

John learned about KADET through an existing client and is happy to access his first loan to uplift his business. 

He plans to purchase stock of keys and padlocks and other assorted tools for his business. With the extra profit, he also plans to expand his business further by procuring machines for his trade to ease and hasten operations, and his future hope is to have a permanent premises for his work.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya

loans.use: Purchasing stock of keys and padlocks, and other assorted tools for his hardware business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
At only 24 years old, Liezel F. of Purok Kalubay, Palaka Norte, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental, is proud of her accomplishments in helping support her small family. Married with only one school-age child, Liezel is determined to provide for her family since her husband is unemployed.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago to start her business selling condiments and vegetables in her community. She is grateful that NWTF took a chance with her in spite of her age, and helped her start her business and guided her on how to handle her finances and how to plan on the expansion of her business. With the help of her husband, all her efforts and tireless determination have paid off as the business now earns PHP 10,000 per month - enough to support their family.

This new loan of PHP 20,000 is Liezel's 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and she plans to use it as rolling capital so that she could buy more produce from the farms to sell to her community.

Liezel is shown in the photo with boxes of farm-fresh tomatoes and onions ready for transport to her food stall in the market.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia O. reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Ana tiene 47 años de edad, vive con sus cuatros hijos todos ya mayores de edad. Ana ha mantenido y sacado adelante a su familia, con mucha fortaleza y  trabajo día con día , Ana ha mantenido a flote su negocio un comedor donde vende variedad de platillos, también mantiene una  venta de ropa interior  y perfumes en su casa, aunque es un negocio muy nuevo Ana ya percibe buenos resultados y es por eso que desea invertir en comprar variedad de productos de belleza
texts.en:
Ana Julia O. lives in the town of Soyapango in the district of San Salvador. She is 47 years old and lives with her 4 adult children. With great strength, Ana works every day in order for her family to get ahead. Ana manages a café where she sells a variety of dishes.

She also sells undergarments and perfumes from home. Although she is new to this business, Ana has experienced good results and wants to buy a variety of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of products that she sells from home

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: arame N. est parent beneficiaire depuis plus de sept ans elle capitalise pluseurs annees d'experience dans la ventes de provisions alimentaires.parallelement aussi elle exerce la vente de parfums.face a l'accroissement de la demande de ses produits elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement.son activite lui permet de participer a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Arame N. has been a parent beneficiary for more than seven years, and has gained many years' experience in the sale of food items. At the same time, she also runs a business selling perfumes. Faced with an increase in demand for her products, she is seeking a loan for 50,000 CFA to strengthen her working capital. Her business allows her to participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Guillermo Antonio H. D. reside en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Guillermo vive con su esposa quien trabaja como comerciante, tienen tres niños todos menores de edad, Guillermo se dedica a su propio negocio es una tapicería donde se elabora variedad en muebles, con doce años de experiencia en la tapicería Guillermo a ganado la confianza y fidelidad de sus clientes, ya que los productos de Guillermo poseen excelente calidad, el crédito que solicita es para destino en capital de trabajo de la tapicería.
texts.en:
Guillermo Antonio H. D. lives in the city of Delgado in the district of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant, and three dependent children.

Guillermo has an upholstery business in which he produces a variety of furniture coverings. With twelve years of experience, Guillermo has been able to gain the trust and loyalty of his customers. His products are of excellent quality. He is requesting a loan to be used as capital to invest into his upholstery business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for his upholstery business

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es: Martha Elizabeth T. D. Z. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta tiene dos hijos D. 20 y 16 años D. edad quienes viven con ella. Martha tiene un negocio el cual ha dedicado gran parte D. su vida, son veinticinco años D. experiencia lo que posee la zapatería,donD. relaiza variedad D. zapatos escolares y tambien casuales para damas, las ventas las realiza D. manera ambulante a varias zonas D. San Salvador, el crédito que solicita Martha es para invertir en materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth T. D. Z. lives with her two children (ages 20 and 16) in the town of Soyapango in the district of San Salvador. She has spent most of her life dedicated to her business. For 25 years, Martha has owned a shoe store where she sells a variety of shoes for school. She also sells casual ladies’ shoes. Most of her sales are completed door-to-door in the various neighborhoods of San Salvador.

Martha is requesting a loan so that she can invest in raw materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo L. is 44 years old, married with 2 school-age children, and resides in Purok Kapayas, Brgy. Malingin, Bago City, Negros Occidental, and he is one of the few male members of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

As he tells it, he was at first hesitant to join because he thought that NWTF-Project Dungganon offered its services exclusively to women, but then a member encouraged him to try his luck anyway, and he was able to become a member. He is very grateful that NWTF gave him a chance to prove that he could improve his business with the help of his first loan.

Alfredo sells a variety of breads and other delicacies to the community. He admits that being self-employed is very hard but he is confident that his dedication to his chosen field makes success inevitable.

He now plans to use his ninth loan from NWTF amounting to PHP 15,000 as rolling capital so that he can offer a wider variety of food products to sell to his loyal customers and ultimately improve the living conditions of his family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angeline is a widow, 43 years old, and she takes care of two children aged 16 and 19.

Angeline works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and employs one person to help her. She earns a monthly profit of 80,000 Rwandan Francs.

Angeline is requesting her first loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs from Vision Finance Company. With this new loan she hopes to purchase more charcoal to sell which will help her to earn more profit in order to pay school fees for her children and get more food for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés D. L. C. D. M. vive en Cojutepeque en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Inés vive solamente con su hija D. 19 años D. edad quien se encuentra estudiando en L. universidad. Inés posee una venta D. cereales ubicada en el mercado D. San Salvador, elL. considera seguir ampliando su negocio ya desea lograr suficientes ahorros que le permitan darle una buena y completa educación a su hija. Ahora Inés solita un crédito para invertir en su negocio en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. cereales para comercializar.

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata K. habite dans le quartier de cambberene depuis plusieurs annees.elle est tres connue dans la commercialisation de tissus principalement mais elle evolue aussi dans la vente de parfums et de jus.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000)frs pour renforcer son capital de roulement.avec ses benefices mensuels elle assiste sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata K. has lived in the Camberene area for several years. She is very well known mainly for her business selling cloth, but she has also developed a business selling perfumes and juice. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her working capital. With her monthly profits, she helps support her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Didier

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! Didier M. is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

Didier is a bread factory owner and he has an experience of 6 years in that business. In his business, he employs 4 people.

Didier is requesting his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more equipment. Afterward, he hopes that his factory will work qualitatively and quantitatively better.

Through accessing this loan, Didier has hope for the future of his family.

loans.use: buying equipment for his factory

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma P. Q. vive en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Ana tiene 38 años de edad, se encuentra separada de su esposo y vive solamente con sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, el ex esposo de Ana le da mensualmente $160.00 US. Ana posee una tienda en su casa ya que no puede salir a trabajar fuera de casa para no descuidar a sus hijos es por ello que lo hace desde su casa con su tienda donde vende productos de consumo, ahora Ana esta solicitando este crédito ya que desea seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, con tu ayuda para este crédito Ana lograra surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas que serán de gran ayuda para ellas y todos sus hijos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 39 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks. She lives in Ibadan Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Yessica Georgina

texts.es: Yessica Georgina R. D. A. vive en Ilopango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Yessica tiene 28 años D. edad, se encuentra casada y vive con sus dos hijos Edwin D. 5 años y Denise D. 12 meses, el esposo D. Yessica es empleado y aporta económicamente a su hogar. Yessica trabaja dentro D. casa ya que por tener a sus hijos tan pequeños no pueD. descuidar su deber maternal  y es así como a equilibrado su trabajo, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su casa a través D. la cual distribuye productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos, además D. ofrecerles por ahora una pequeña variedad D. ropa para dama y caballeros, el crédito que solicita Yessica es para seguir comprando ropa para vender ya que tiene mucha demanda D.  sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yessica Georgina R. D. A. lives in Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She is 28 years old, married, and lives with her two children, Edwin (age 5) and Denise (age 12 months). Her husband is employed and contributes to the household income. Yessica works from home so that she can look after her young children. She has a small shop that sells basic goods in her neighborhood and also offers them a selection of clothes for women and men. Yessica is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell because of high customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is 30 years old and married with 2 children. He has been in business for long. He is requesting for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more cement and sand for moulding block.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and sand for moulding block

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha D. is from the village of Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old. Editha is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of products such as chicken eggs, snack foods, soap, coffee and toothpaste in the local community. Editha is just starting this business.

In 2009, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. of Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental, is a 62-year-old widow with six grown children. She has been sewing clothes for a living for almost 40 years and at present nets a profit of PHP 3,000 per month.

Despite her senior citizenship, Julieta says that she is grateful that the Lord God still gives her the strength to continue her tailoring business. And through the help and guidance of  NWTF-Project Dungganon, which she considers as her second home because of the support and trust that the people there give her in spite of her age, she is confident that she can still contribute to the community by sewing clothes for her neighbors, and in turn stay independent by earning her own living.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 9,500 for her 10th loan cycle from NWTF so that she could buy fabrics and other sewing materials for her business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Lolade

texts.en: Lolade is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs and provisions. She has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the village of Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Carmelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling native medicinal coconut wine products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite K. is 38years old ,married  and she has  two children with the following years old : 13,11,20. and she takes care of  one dependent.

Marguerite   is requesting  her first loan From Vision Finance Company .she works from 6:00am to 6:00pm  and employs one person to help her .

she  earns mounthly profit of  70,000 Rwandan Francs . She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs. With this new loan she hopes to purchase more charcoal  to sell which will help her to get more profit in order to pay  school fees for her children, to expand her business.

loans.use: purchising more charcoal sales

loans.name: Luz Magali

texts.es:
Luz vive en la calle del Cebollar 3-44 en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada concibió 4 hijos de 14, 10, 5, 3 años de edad el mayor de sus hijos esta estudiando en el colegio Cesar Dávila, y sus hijos menores se encuentran en la escuela República de Alemania.

Viven en casa de sus padres pero no son dependientes de ellos, su esposo es chofer de una empresa y es el mayor apoyo en su hogar, siendo su mano derecha.

Luz se dedica a la elaboración de peluches, trabaja en este negocio unos 5 años, es un buen negocio por que todo el tiempo se vende peluches y mucho más en los meses de navidad y San Valentín, trabaja junto con sus hijos.


Lleva 6 ciclos en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR y le agrada los beneficios que recibe y el buen trato que les ofrecen, con el  préstamo que la fundación le concede va a invertir en su negocio comprando más material como es felpa, plumón, tela, encaje, poliéster, ojos, etc. 

El beneficio de trabajar en casa  es que pasa todo el tiempo a lado de sus hijos y no se descuida de su hogar, su meta para el futuro es de llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz lives on 3-44 Cebollar Street, in the city of Cuenca. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, ages 14, 10, 5, and 3 years old. The oldest of her children is studying in the high school Cesar Dávila. Her younger children are in the school República de Alemania (Republic of Germany). They live in their parent's house, but they are not dependent on them. Her husband is a driver for a business and is the biggest support in the home, being the right-hand man.

Luz makes plush toys. She has worked in this business for 5 years or so. It is a good business because she sells plush toys all year long, and even more during the Christmas months and St. Valentine's Day. She works together with her children.

She has been with the FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR for six cycles, and she is grateful for the benefits she receives and the good treatment they offer. With the loan that the foundation will give her, she is going to invest in her business, purchasing more material, such as plush, down, fabric, lace, polyester, eyes, etc.

The benefit of working at home is that she can spend all day with her children at her side, and she can take care of her home. Her goal for the future is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business in the purchase of materials such as: plush, down, fabric, lace, eyes, etc.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en: T. Alice is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 38 years old and the mother of five children in school and she takes care of two dependents. Alice has been in the tailoring business for nine years. It is located in Mbaba trading centre and at the moment, she is able to make some profits. The way her business operates is that customers bring her clothing materials with their own designs and she charges for the services. For some, she sells the clothing materials to them plus the sewing, hence making twice the income. Alice needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials for resale plus to buy threads and needles for quick services.

loans.use: Buying clothing materials, threads, needles and other accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 35 years old and married with two children. She has a patent shop where she sells medicine. She has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more medicine to sell and to add sales of frozen meat.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and frozen meat to sell

loans.name: Nifemi

texts.en: Nifemi is 32 years old and married with two children. She sells sarongs and kitchen utensils. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Aromeñitas Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Senkata ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, hace diez años, se formo la asociación “Aromeñitas”, Otilia C. que actualmente es la presidenta, es una de las fundadoras, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas a formar parte del grupo.
Las integrantes de este grupo en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, diferente productos son vendidos en ferias y puestos de la ciudad , Martha por ejemplo vende papa en la feria 12 de octubre (El Alto), otras socias venden, zapatos, mandiles, plásticos, medias, juguetes, además también Narciso C., que también es integrante del grupo ofrece servicio de taxi. La asociación Aromeñitas necesita comprar productos en mayor cantidad para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: Doña Martha Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el barrio la fuente, casada y con tres hijos que estudian, su esposo vende ropa, y ella granos básicos y una variedad de productos, ella inicio las venta hace varios años vendía cerdo pero con la enfermedad del ahn1se le vino abajo las ventas, el cual requirió de su ahorros y préstamo en Afodenic para lograr la compra de granos básicos, el cual ha salido adelante con las ventas. Con este crédito comprara 28 quintales de frijoles para incrementar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es seguir creciendo en venta como obtener la clientela. Se ha beneficiado con los préstamos y da las gracias  ala institución por su desarrollo económico como personal.
texts.en:
Doña Martha Rosa is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. She and her family live in the neighborhood of La Fuente. Her husband sells clothes, while she sells grains and variety of other products. She started her business several years ago by selling pork from her home, but the recent outbreak of swine flu impacted her sales in a negative way.

With her savings and a loan from AFODENIC, she purchased basic grains so that she could continue making sales. For this loan request, she will buy 28 quintales (1 quintal = 46 kg) of beans so that she can increase her sales and achieve better returns. She hopes her sales continue to grow as she obtains more customers. Doña Martha Rosa has benefitted from her previous loans and is grateful to the Institution for helping her develop financially as well as personally.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans in large quantities

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en: Z. Prossy is a 38-year-old married mother of five children, aged 16 – 6 years as she helps to take care of 1 orphan. She has owned and operated a retail grocery shop for 8 years and she is happy to say that her shop is doing so well with the help of loans. She is able to have plenty to sell hence making some good profits that have enabled her to take care of her family for all this long. She needs a loan to be able to save some more money to be able to buy a plot of land so that she and her husband could be able to construct a presentable family house for her children.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more sugar, cooking oil and other confectionaries once given a loan.

loans.name: Omoloye

texts.en: Omoloye is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She sells firewood and rents out videos to earn a living. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more videos and firewood to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more videos and firewood.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou K. habite camberene et s's'active dans l'aviculture depuis plus de six ans.face a la demande croissante elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs afin d'elargir son poullailer et en meme temps accroitre ses sujets.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis plus de sept ans et compte sur son activite pour soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou K. lives in Camberene and has been working at poultry-raising for more than 6 years. In view of the growing demand, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to expand her chicken yard and buy more chicks to raise. She is a parent and has been a participant for more than 7 years and counts on her business to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: enlarging her poultry business

loans.name: Neli Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Neli Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas, un bankito muy sólido, solidario y unido llevan muchos años realizando prestamos y son las personas más agradecidas porque gracias a estos préstamos han logrado superarse y sacar  a sus familias adelante, brindándoles una vida digna y se encuentran muy orgullosas de sus logros, como grupo son muy alegres y extrovertidas se llevan muy bien entre todas, aquí el testimonio de una socia. 

Neli vive en la centro de Cuenca en las calles Gaspar Sangurima y Antonio Borrero,  tiene 41 años de edad, concibió 2 hijos: uno  de 20 y otro de  9 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos se graduó este año en el colegio Francisco Tamariz y su hijo menor estudia en la escuela Julio Matovelle, viven arrendando, su esposo emigro al extranjero para darles un mejor porvenir y como tiene legalizada su situación regresa a verlos cuando el tiempo lo permite o en fechas especiales.

Neli  tiene un local de bisutería y le va muy bien, su horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana a 6 y media de la tarde, la ventaja de tener su propio negocio es que con las ganancias que obtiene paga el departamento y su local comercial.

Se llevan muy bien entre las socias y son muy buenas amigas, en la fundación se siente bien atendida y  contenta con los beneficios que obtiene, este es  su tercer ciclo a lado de la fundación y el préstamo que  realiza es para la ampliación de su negocio comprando mecadería con nuevos modelos y diseños para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Los sueños que tiene Neli es de viajar y conocer algunos lugares del mundo.
texts.en:
Sra. Neli Victoria is a member of the community bank Mujeres Progresistas (Progressive Women), a very solid little bank, supportive, and united. For many years they have been making loans, and they are very grateful people because thanks to the loans they have succeeded in improving themselves and moving their families forward, offering them a decent life. They are very proud of their achievements. As a group they are very happy and extroverted, and they all get along very well between them. Here is a statement from a member.

Neli lives in the center of Cuenca, in the streets Gaspar Sangurima and Antonio Borrero. She is 41 years old, has 2 children: one is 20, and the other one is 9 years old. Her older child graduated this year from the high school Francisco Tamariz, and her younger son studies in the school Julio Matovelle. They live in a rented house, and her husband migrated abroad in order to give them a better future and as they have legalized his situation, he returns home to see them when time permits or on special dates.

Neli has a costume jewelry business, which is going very well. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 6.30 in the evening. The advantage of having her own business is that with the profits that she earns, she pays for the apartment and her commercial premises.

She gets along very well with the members of the bank, and they are all very good friends. In the foundation, she feels very well attended, and happy with the benefits that she receives. This is her third cycle with the foundation, and the loan that they will make is for the expansion of her business, purchasing merchandise with new models and designs in order to satisfy the requests of her customers. Neli's dream is to travel and to get to know some places around the world.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and buy merchandise with new models and designs
