payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: Robinah N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugasa. She is 49 years old and married with 10 children ages 11-25.  Her oldest child is attending University. She also cares for orphans, taking them to school and feeding them just like her own children. Robinah is a fishmonger in Buwoya town.  She started out selling matooke but changed after realizing that she could earn more selling fish, and now she has been doing so for 15 years. She is grateful for the loans because it allows her to buy enough stock without running out. She requests a new loan to buy more fish so she can earn more profits and pay for her children to attend school next term.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Marcial Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Marcial Ignacio G., tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en el barrio, las conchitas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto  a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos, los cuales son independientes, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Marcial inicio esta actividad agrícola con esfuerzos propios desde hace nueve años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo por que a veces no le da para comprar los fertilizantes necesarios y poder terminar con las plagas. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumo el cual aplicara para obtener una mejor producción y vender a mejor precio al mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad para poder desarrollarse en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcial Ignacio G. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Las Conchitas, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Both he and his wife work in order to cover the household expenses. They have two adult children and plan to improve their living conditions in the future.

Don Marcial has been farming for the past nine years. His greatest difficulty has been eradicating diseases that have plagued his crops because he could not afford to buy fertilizers that would have helped prevent them. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers and other treatments to apply to his crops so that production will improve and he will be able to command a higher price at market. He thanks the Institution for giving him the opportunity to succeed with his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & other supplies

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Villa Exaltación (El Alto-La Paz), se reúne la asociación “Sartawi”, está formado por catorce integrantes, estos trabajan de manera responsable en sus actividades internas, cumpliendo su séptimo ciclo junto a Pro Mujer.
Actualmente los alimentos son la base de los negocios de este grupo,  por ejemplo: venta de queso, carne de res, carne de pollo, otras socias venden almuerzos en pensiones y puesto de mercado,  también tienen tiendas de barrio. Desean aumentar su producción y ventas para esto necesitan comprar insumos y/o productos (compra de papa, carne, víveres, aceite y otros), buscan en este tipo de negocio mayor rentabilidad para obtener mejores ingresos que les permita ofrecer sostenibilidad economía en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association known as “Sartawi” meets in downtown of Villa Exaltación (El Alto-La Paz) and is made up of 14 responsible members who have completed their seventh cycle with "Pro Mujer" (Professional Woman). At the moment food is the foundation of the group’s business. For example, they sell cheese, beef, chicken, and other members provide lunch services and work in market stalls. They also work in neighborhood stalls. They wish to increase their production and sales. To accomplish this they will need to buy supplies and/or products (potatoes, meat, food, oil, and other products). In this business they look forward to greater profitability to increase their income and offer financial support back home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of supplies and/or products.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela A. M., tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio Esquí pulas , ubicado hacia carretera Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , los cuales trabajan y le apoyan , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Graciela desde hace cuatro años tiene un comedor , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que todavía no tiene bien  acondicionado el local y cuando llueve ese moja el cual es un mal servicio y a que los clientes se mojan y en verano le afecta el sol , los planes futuros hacia su negocio es ver construido su local . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder comenzar hacer las mejoras y poder dar un mejor servicio. Da las gracia a la institución por hacer de su negocio un mejor centro de venta.
texts.en:
Graciela A. M. is 43 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Esquí Pulas, which is located near the Masaya Highway. Both she and her husband work to cover the household expenses. They have three children who work and help them at home. They have plans to improve the living conditions for their family.

Doña Graciela has been operating a cafeteria for the past four years. Her greatest difficulty has been dealing with the unsuitable conditions of her existing location. Customers get wet when it rains and the sun becomes unbearable in the summer. In the future, she plans to build a new structure for her business. Doña Graciela will use her loan to buy construction materials so that she can start making improvements and provide better service. She thanks the Institution for making her business a better establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a new structure to house her business

loans.name: Nuve Victoria

texts.es:
Nuve Victoria vive en las calles General Torres y Gaspar Sangurima en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 14, 10 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio Manuel J. Calle y el menor en la escuela Ezequiel Crespo, lleva varios años separada por que su esposo emigro dejándole con sus hijos aun pequeños y aún viven arrendando.

Desarrolla muchas labores los cuales le han permitido salir adelante, trabaja en la EMAC (Empresa Muncipal de Aseo de Cuenca)de lunes a viernes y su horario es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. y los fines de semana trabaja como comerciante vendiendo ropa muy surtida, también se dedica a la venta productos para la belleza de la mujer como son los productos de Yanbal.

Lleva en su negocio unos 6 años y dice que la ventaja de trabajar así es que de sus ventas obtiene para pagar del arriendo y unos gastos más de su casa.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación y le da mucha emoción porque va logrando superarse poco a poco, el préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería  como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y mas productos de belleza Yambal, de esta manera  prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientas.

Su sueño es llegar a comprar un carro para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nuve Victoria lives on the streets General Torres and Gaspar Sangurima in the center of the city of Cuenca. She is 38 years old, and has four children, aged 18, 17, 14, and 10 years old. All of her children are studying in the high school Manuel J. Calle, and the youngest is in the school Ezequiel Crespo. She has been separated for several years because her husband migrated, leaving her with their young children, living in a rented house.

She has many jobs which have allowed her to get ahead. She works in the EMAC (Empresa Municipal de Aseo de Cuenca) (Municipal Waste Services of Cuenca) from Monday to Friday from 8am to 6pm. On the weekends, she works as a shopkeeper selling a wide variety of clothing. She also sells women's beauty products, such as Yanbal products.

She has had her business 6 years or so, and says that the advantage of working like that is that from her sales she is able to pay her rent and some more expenses of the home. It is her third time working with the foundation, and it gives her a lot of excitement, because she will continue getting ahead little by little. She will invest the loan in the purchase of additional merchandise, such as clothing for women, men, and children, and more Yanbal beauty products. This way she will offer a better service to her customers.

Her dream is to purchase a car in order to give better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise such as clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells building and tailoring materials. She has been in the business for more than 18 years. This business is the source of her income. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more building and tailoring materials to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: sales of building and tailoring materials

loans.name: Akwesi

texts.en: Akwesi J. is single and has two children. He has completed junior high school. Akwesi sells phones and accessories in Elmina, and has been doing so since 2007. Akwesi uses his income to pay school fees for his children. Akwesi will use the loan to buy more cell phones and accessories for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Akwesi plans to save up to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.es: Reynelda A. Vda. D. G. D. 60 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Reynelda  es una mujer viuda y vive solamente con sus dos hijos ya mayores D. edad y empledos. Reynelda posee un negocio en su casa el cual es el medio D. sustento económico en su vida, ella trabaja en su negocio todos los días es una tienda surtida con productos  D. consumo, Reynelda quiere comprar nueva mercadería que le ayuD. a incrementar sus margen D. ventas, por medio D. este crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Reynelda A. Vda. D. G. is 60 years old and lives in the district of Ahuachapán. Reynelda is a widow and lives with her two adult children who are employed. She operates a business from home which generates income for her living expenses. She works every day from her store stocked with consumer products. Reynelda is requesting a loan in order to buy new merchandise so that she can increase her sales margins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Badmus

texts.en: Badmus is 62 years old and married with 10 children who are in school. He makes mirrors and also sells gift items. He is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more gift items to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items to sell.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal Y. is single and has four children. She has completed senior high school. Racheal sells books and stationary items at Nyanta near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007.  Racheal uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She requests a loan to buy more stationary to sell in her shop, and plans to reinvest the additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: Racheal will use the loan to buy more stationary to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Alina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Alina Hernández, tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto  a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos, una de ella independiente y dos actualmente estudiantes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Rosa desde hace 25 años se dedica a las confecciones, con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de Afodenic, ella a logrado mejorar gran parte de su vivienda. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piso para que le pongan el piso y poder gozar de la comodidad junto a  su familia. es sus sexto crédito y ha invertido con los anteriores prestamos en las mejoras para su vivienda para logar una casa digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para poner el piso

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia C. R. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su único hijo Reynaldo de 22 años quien está cursando la universidad. María es una mujer divorsiada ha trabajado gran parte de su vida en el negocio que hoy por hoy en es el pilar económico para sobrevivir; ella posee un restaurante con 22 años de experiencia, María solita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para su negocio, ya que no logra cubrir la demanda de comida por parte de sus clientes, es por eso la urgencia de aumentar su producción en su restaurante.
texts.en:
María Eugenia C. R. is divorced and lives in the district of Ahuachapán with her only son Reynaldo, who is a 22 year old university student. She has worked much of her life in the business that has been her economic foundation and has helped her to survive.

María has 22 years experience in the restaurant business. She is requesting a loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients because she is not able to keep up with the demand of her customers. Therefore, it is urgent that she increase the production of her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa Lilian A. D. F. vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo quien trabaja como transportista, sus tres hijos, su nuera y un nieto D. tan solo 12 meses D. nacido. Toda la familia D. Rosa trabaja para ayudarse mutuamente en las responsabilidades del hogar, y Rosa no es la excepción ella maneja su propio negocio ubicado en su casa en una tienda con productos D. consumo, rosa posee ocho años D. experiencia en su negocio y ahora solicita este crédito ya que desea invertir en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Lilian A. D. F. lives in Atiquizaya in the district of Ahuachapán. Her husband works as a delivery carrier. They have three children, a daughter-in-law, and a 12 month old grandson. All of Rosa’s family share in the household responsibilities, and she is no exception.

She manages a home-based business selling consumer products. Rosa has 8 years of business experience and is now requesting a loan to invest in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena M. reside en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos de 15 y 12 años de edad estudiantes. Rosa tiene 15 años de trabajar desde su casa elaborando tortillas todas las tardes el negocio de Rosa no es solo la elaboración de las mismas también vende granos básicos por libra, este crédito lo solicita para abastecerse de mayor cantidad de granos para vender, de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has been selling baby items for a long time. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.  Bose is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more baby items to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel A. B., tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, Ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Miguel desde hace 30 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de fertilizantes , los planes hacia futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para lograr mejorar el cultivo  y poder estar en mejores condiciones y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Agradecido con Afodenic es su octavo ciclo en préstamos los cuales ha sido para mejorar su negocio  y el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar abonos para aplicar a la siembra

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 46 years old and married with one daughter who is currently in college training to be a nurse. Dora works very hard to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader, running a provision store in her community. Dora buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de granos, los cuales compra en las comunidades andinas y posteriormente vende los fines de semana en las ciudades aledañas a la suya. De esta manera obtiene ganancias semanales con las cuales compra más mercadería y solventa las necesidades de su hogar. Sus años de experiencia le han demostrado que su negocio es rentable, ya que lleva productos alimenticios que son escasos en la ciudad y por ende, muy demandados. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de un banco comunal porque conocen de su trabajo responsable, por lo que Antonia se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. El monto que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más mercadería, la cual almacenará e ira vendiendo conforme la demanda.
texts.en:
Antonia, 49, lives with her husband and their three children in a rented house. For five years she has been selling grains. She buys them in the Andean communities. She later sells them on the week ends in the neighboring cities and her own. This is the way she gets weekly income to buy more merchandise and to pay for her household necessities. Years of experience have shown that her business is profitable. She carries food products that are scarce in her city; therefore they are in much demand. This is her first loan with MFP. She was invited to join a community bank because they know of her responsible work. Antonia promises to be punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, which she will store and sell according to the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance T. is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Ntungamo. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children ages 18-26.  She also cares for 4 orphans who all attend school. She is a businesswoman who has been in commercial agriculture since 1982.  Although she faces challenges like seasonality and price fluctuations, she is able to make weekly profits of between 60,000 – 90,000 UGX from the sale of matooke alone. She sells in three different locations - Kakungu village, Omungyenyi county and Rubaare subcounty - and one day she hopes to sell in just one location because transporting the produce to all these places is expensive and tiresome. The profits she makes enable her to educate her children so they can become self reliant.  This is why she requests a loan to help purchase manure and tools for modernizing her farming practices.

loans.use: To buy manure and tools for better farming.

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She makes and sells hats. She has been in the business since 1988. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more hat materials, to make more hat to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hat-making materials

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia dedicado, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hace 5 años decidió crear su propia fuente de ingresos, para ello, abrió una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la cual con el tiempo ha crecido y hoy es un minimarket que abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo de comestibles de primera de necesidad y otros diversos artículos. Debido a la gran variedad de los productos que ofrece se ha ganado la preferencia de sus clientes, quienes reciben una buena atención, que es el valor agregado que les brida Armando y su esposa. Para el futuro, esta pareja de esposos quieren seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener un local más amplio y con mayor variedad de productos. Esta es la primera vez que Armando tiene un crédito con MFP, es un nuevo integrante de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en menestras y detergentes.
texts.en:
Armando is a 47-year-old father and husband devoted to his two children and wife. Five years ago he decided to go into business for himself and opened a small grocery store in his home. His business has grown and over time become a mini-market that provides his customers with a tremendous variety of high quality goods. Armando and his wife are very attentive and offer such a wide range of goods; they have won over their customers. They would like to continue to grow their business, having a bigger space and an even wider array of products. This is the fist time Armando is applying for a loan with MFP as he is a new member of his communal bank. He promises to pay his loan back responsibly. He plans to buy vegetables and detergents with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: sokhna N. est un parent beneficiaire evoluant dans la vente de produits cosmetiques et d'autres effets de beaute pour femmes.elle capitalise une experience de cinq ans dans cet activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement.l'augmentation de ses benefice lui permettra de renforcer l'assistance de son mari dans les charges familliales.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Ademola

texts.en: Ademola is 45 years old and married with three children. He is a printer and has a small printing machine for his printing business. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es: Betzabeth es una joven madre de 24 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Hace 6 años empezó vendiendo comida de forma ambulante y en la actualidad tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde recientemente implementó una sección de útiles escolares. Su tienda está ubicada en su misma casa y esto le permite atender a sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Betzabeth está planificando seguir incrementando la cantidad y variedad de productos que ofrece. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella una de las socias con mayor tiempo de permanencia en su banco comunal, por lo que renueva su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas programadas. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de comestibles, útiles escolares y otros artículos para surtir su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia A. D. G. resiD. en Ilopango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta tiene 51 años D. edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas D. 18,16 y 15 años D. edad todas estudiantes. Marta se dedica a su negocio hace trece años, es una pupuseria ubicada en una zona estratégica donD. transcurren muchos peatones a lo largo D. todo el dia, pero también Marta ya es muy conocida en la zona, ella tiene una cleintela estable, ella solicta este crédito para compra D. materia prima que le permite aumentar su producción en sus pupusas ya que desea incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia A. D. G. lives in Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She is 51 years old and lives in own her home with her three school-aged daughters (ages 18, 16, and 15).

Marta has been in business for 13 years. She operates a pupuseria in an strategically located area frequented by pedestrians most of the day. Marta is well-known in the neighborhood and has a stable customer base. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so that she can increase her production of pupusas, which translates into more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: S. Godfrey is a client of Pearl microfinance in Ntungamo. He is 49 years old and married with 6 children aged 15 – 6 years as he takes care of 1 orphan and all the children are in school. He is a business man involved in banana trading in Ishunga Cell for 9 years and at the moment he makes a profit of 30,000/= from the sale of matooke a week. In addition to his good customer care skills, Godfrey would like a loan to help expand his business by increasing his capital base so that he can be able to buy more matooke for resale. He has high hopes of seeing all his children educated since this is the first key to success. He is a hard working and determined man who works hand in hand with his wife and children so that they could enjoy the fruits together.

loans.use: Buying more bananas for resale so as to make more profits.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 48 years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. Afia works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. They live in a rented apartment in Oda in eastern Ghana.

Afia is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community, preparing and selling all kinds of local dishes. She procures her food supplies in nearby towns at moderate prices.

Afia has been in business for over fifteen years and would like a loan to buy goods in bulk so as to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food supplies

loans.name: Ines Lorena

texts.es:
Inés vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años y esta felizmente casada, fruto de su amor procreo 3 hijos: de 9 y 7 años y,  una bebe de 7 meses de nacida. Viven arrendando aún dice Inés.

Su esposo es tecnólogo en sistemas y ella  trabaja conjuntamente con el en un local donde venden piezas de computadoras, dan mantenimiento, venden y recargan cartuchos de impresoras y un sin numero de artículos para computadoras e impresoras; trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 7 de la noche le va muy bien en su negocio por los buenos servicios que ofrecen a sus clientes.

Este es su tercer año trabajando junto a la fundación, le gusta el trato, el asesoramiento que le brindan, las charlas de capacitación y motivación y, los intereses que le brindan son bajos. Con el préstamo que realiza va ha implementar su negocio comprando suministros de computación y accesorios como son  partes y piezas de computadora para de esta manera  mantener un stock adecuado para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes,e ir creciendo hasta llegar a ser una empresa distribuidora.
 
Su meta para un futuro es llegar a tener su casa propia para que sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Inés lives in central Cuenca. She is 32 years old, happily married, and has 3 children (ages 9, 7, and 7 months). Inés says that her family is renting their home.

Her husband is a systems technologist and she works with him at their shop where they sell computer parts, perform maintenance, refill printer cartridges, and offer several other computer and printer accessories. They work from 8am to 7pm, and business has been doing very well because of the excellent service they provide to their customers.

This will be the third year that Inés has been working with the Foundation. She enjoys working with the organization and all the services she has received – the advice, discussions, training, motivation, and the low interest rates. With her loan, Inés plans to buy computer supplies, accessories, and parts so that she can maintain an adequate stock and continue providing good service to her customers. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and become a distribution center.

Her future goal is to have her own home where her children can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer parts & accessories

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband who is a trader to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Agnes is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Agnes procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. She has been in business for over twelve years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Costeñitas Ii Group

texts.es: El  centro focal villa Exaltación encuentra ubicado en la zona del mismo nombre,de la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Costeñitas II”, actualmente está formado por diez miembros. Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, por ejemplo Beatriz tiene un puesto de cerveza, Omar realiza tejidos de chompas para colegios, Miriam vende ropa para bebes, María vende cosméticos, Guadalupe  tiene una pensión familiar, Rosario vende chompas. Todas afirman que necesitan capital para la compra de productos en mayor cantidad, con esto aumentaran sus ventas y mejoraran las condiciones económicas en sus hogares.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es: El señor Saúl Antonio P. de 30 años de edad, casado , reside junto con su esposa e hijos en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su hijo tiene 2 años de edad, sus planes es poder tener su propia casa ya que donde habitan es en casa de la mama. El trabaja como asistente de maestro de obra. Para poder cubrir las necesidades ya que su profesión es de medicina pero por motivo de desempleo no ha logrado ubicarse. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y lograr la comodidad con su familia. Sus planes es poder sacar una especialidad en medicina y poder ejercer su profesión y lograr estabilidad económica, lo que será de muchos beneficios para su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados.

loans.use: Comaprar materiales de construccion para hacer un cuarto

loans.name: Diana Fernanda

texts.es:
Diana vive en Cuenca  en el centro de la ciudad; tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y este año ingresa al primer año de Psicología Clínica en la Universidad Estatal de Cuenca, vive en casa de sus padres por lo que aun es dependiente de ellos, su casa es propia.

Diana trabaja vendiendo productos Herbalife (son productos de medicina natural) algún tiempo ya  y le va muy bien, tiene muchos clientes, nos dice.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación y le ha sido de mucha ayuda por lo que le han permitido emprender con un negocio productivo y así empezar a independizarse y valerse por si misma.

El préstamo que realiza en la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de  productos herbalife que le hacen falta e incrementar  un stock más surtido de estos productos naturales para sus clientes.

Su meta para el futuro es culminar los estudios para ser una profesional y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana is 21 years old, single, and lives in central Cuenca. She will be starting her first year at the State University of Cuenca, where she will be studying clinical psychology. She still lives at home with her parents because she is still financially dependent on them.

Diana has been selling Herbalife (natural medicines) for some time now and is doing very well. She tells us that she has many customers.

Diana is now working on her third loan cycle with the Foundation. The assistance she received enabled her to start her business so that she can become productive, independent, and self-reliant. She will use her loan to purchase more Herbalife products so that she can increase her inventory and provide her customers with a better selection.

Her goal for the future is to complete her studies so that she can become a professional and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of Herbalife products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: sokhna N. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1997 ,demeurant a camberene ,evoluant dans le commerce et la vente de cosmetiques et divers effets pour femmes.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement et accroitre ses benefices en vue de mieux assister son mari a supporter les charges familliales.
texts.en:
Sokhna N. is a parent and has been a participant since 1997. She lives in Camberene and sells cosmetics and various products for women. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to add to her working capital and increase her profit so as to be better able to help her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters who are still in school. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for the family.  She is a trader. She trades utensils. She buys her goods in Kumasi and hawks to sell. She also treks to other communities to sell. Grace has been in business for over twenty years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Folo

texts.fr:
Folo K. 27 ans, est micro-entrepreneur basé à la rive gauche du fleuve Congo à Kisangani. Cette ville de la République Démocratique du Congo, qui est située au nord de la ligne de l’Equateur dans la province Orientale, frontalière avec le Soudan et l’Ouganda. C’est une ville qui a souffert de plusieurs guerres surtout celle de 2000 an, qui a amené deux armées étrangères à s’affronter en pleine ville causant ainsi beaucoup de pertes en vies humaines.
Après cette sombre période, Folo a décidé de commencer son activité en vendant de la braise. Au fil de temps et grâce aux revenus accumulés, il est parvenu à ouvrir une boutique qui lui génère aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $20 par semaine. Il est client fidèle qui a déjà reçu 4 fois les crédits de l’Institution de Micro Finance HOPE Kisangani et les a remboursés correctement. Le prochain prêt lui servira à renforcer le stock de la marchandise pour répondre à la demande de ses et accroitre aussi le revenu. Folo travaille durement en épargnant pour réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un jour un restaurant et d’assurer aussi les études de ses deux enfants âgés de 2 mois et de 3 ans.

loans.use: renforcer le stock de la marchandise pour répondre à la demnade de ses clients

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Ntungamo. She is a 50 year old widow with 9 children of her own and she looks after 4 dependents. She is a business lady involved in commercial agriculture and market vending whereby she grows her own produce to sell in the market. She has been in this business for 20 years and her business has had very few competitors all along or even if they are there, her services keep her at the level she desires. She operates from three different locations but she would like to be stationed in one trading centre so that all her customers find her there for the produce. She would like a loan to help buy manure, grass and tools and to employ workers on her farm.

loans.use: Buying manure, grass and tools for her farm improvement.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas, un bankito muy sólido, solidario y unido. Llevan muchos años realizando prestamos y son las personas más agradecidas porque gracias a estos préstamos han logrado superarse y sacar  a sus familias adelante, brindándoles una vida digna y se encuentran muy orgullosas de sus logros, como grupo son muy alegres y extrovertidas se llevan muy bien entre todas, aquí el testimonio de una socia. 

María vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 57 años de edad;  es viuda hace cuatro años y medio, tiene 6 hijos de 27, 24, 22, 20, 17, 14 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros trabajan y estudian excepto sus dos últimos hijos que solo estudian y le ayudan en  casa, su hija mayor se encuentra en Chile realizando una maestría en hidrosanitarios y avalúos;  no poseen casa propia.

María trabaja como empleada privada en la unidad educativa El Americano y lo bueno de trabajar en la institución es que obtiene un ingreso fijo, también tiene una tiendita en su casa  trabajando en ella unos 6 años y los beneficios que ha obtenido en la tienda es que se ayuda para los buses, la comida y otros gastos extras que nunca faltan, en su tienda le ayudan su hijos menores, siendo un gran apoyo en su vida.

María trabaja aproximadamente 10 años con la fundación y se siente satisfecha por la confianza que le han brindado, la comprensión y el apoyo recibido, el préstamo que realiza es para la inversión en su tienda para surtirle mucho más, mejorar el servicio, mantener y obtener una nueva clientela.

Su meta es mejorar su negocio, incrementarlo poco a poco y, mantener un stock adecuado de productos para sus clientes   para llegar a  independizarse y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of Progressive Women’s Community Bank, a small, solid, and united bank. They have fulfilled loans for many years. They are the most grateful individuals since they have been able to improve their standard of living for themselves and their families. This is apparent since they can offer them a suitable life and are very proud of their accomplishments. The group as a whole is cheerful and extroverted. They get along well among themselves. Here is a testimony from one of their members. Maria lives in the center of the city, Cuenca, is 57 years old, and is a widow now four years and a half. She has 6 children ranging from ages 27, 24, 22, 20, 17, and 14. They are all single. They work and study except for the two youngest who only study and help around the house. Her eldest daughter is in Chile earning a master’s degree in hydro-sanitary and appraisal. They do not own a home of their own. Maria works as a private employee in the Educational Unit, The American, and the best thing about working in this institution is that she has a fixed income. She has also worked six years in a small shop she has in her home so she can afford bus fees, food and other expenses which are always coming up. Her youngest children help her run the store and greatly support her in life. Maria has worked approximately 10 years with the foundation and is satisfied with the trust, understanding, and support she has received. The loan will be invested in her store and will provide a wider assortment of goods, improve service, and attract new customers. Her goals are to improve her business, build it little by little, maintain an abundant stock of products for her customers, to become independent and teach her children how to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her business with more merchandise and improve service

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo Esnider

texts.es: Don Pablo es soltero, de 53 años de edad, trabaja en el Supermercado San Antonio como Director Financiero desde hace 16 años, ademas cuenta con un negocio de un taxi que le genera ingresos adicionales, tiene hijos los cuales son mayores de edad pero siempre les brinda su apoyo.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito para ponerle ceramica a su casa de habitacion pues actualmente el piso es embaldosado y el que se encuentra en mal estado, y de esta manera mejoraria sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Poner ceramica a su casa

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Desde hace 21 años se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa, ella prepara los platos típicos de su zona y los ofrece por la mañanas y las tardes, todos los días. Su esposo la apoya en trasladar los objetos pesados cada vez que Delia lo necesita así. Y debido a que su casa está ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad sus ventas son exitosas. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite tener capital para su negocio cuando lo necesita. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina, comestibles y bedidas.
texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters. She has sold food from her doorway for 21 years. Delia prepares local dishes and sells them in the morning and afternoon and because her house is located on a heavily trafficked street her sales are very good. Her husband helps her by moving heavy objects whenever she needs him to do so. This is Delia’s sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy being a member of her communal bank because it allows her to have capital for her business when she needs it. She will buy kitchen utensils, food, and drinks with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and utencils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peace's Group

texts.en: B. Peace is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. She is 50 years old and a widow with 6 children aged 21 – 13 of which 5 are in secondary school while 1 is in primary seven. Peace has a hotel business in Nyamafuru where she sells local food and soft drinks for 2 years and because her business is still small, she makes 10,000/= as profits a week. She has hope that once she can access more capital, she will be able to increase her profitability because her hygiene is good with less competition. She needs to expand her hotel so that it could make more profits that will take all her children through school to the University level so that they can secure their own jobs. She is a hard working lady who started this business from nothing after the death of her husband.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs, more folks and spoons for her restaurant expansion.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty-three years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters who are all still in school. As a single parent, she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, groundnut, beans, etc. She supplies to retailers in her community and treks as well. Georgina procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de comida, desde su juventud ha vendido de manera ambulante platillos al paso, pero actualmente ya cuenta con su propio local donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de los diferentes talleres de mecánica automotriz que abundan alrededor de su establecimiento y conocen de la buena sazón de Felicita. Debido a las buenas ganancias que le proporciona su pequeño restaurante ha decidió continuar dedicándose a este rubro y mejorar la apariencia de su local. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Felicita tiene grandes deseos de seguir realizando un trabajo solidario con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de utensilios para su establecimiento, asó como la renovación de su estante y sus mesas.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios y muebles para su negocio

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Georges

texts.fr:
Georges K. vend des poules et porcs à Kisangani. Une ville victime des guerres atroces en 2000 an, causée par deux armées étrangères qui l’ont cicatrisée. Kisangani est une ville principale de la province Orientale localisée au nord de la ligne de l’Equateur et frontalière avec le Soudan et l’Ouganda.
Georges est éleveur et aussi vendeur. Il vend au marché central de la ville. Son activité soutient sa famille et l’aide à préparer l’avenir de ses enfants. Son ambition est de créer une entreprise de transport qui est très indispensable à Kisangani. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $90 par semaine. Il compte avec le prochain prêt, élargir son activité en achetant des produits de consommation sollicités par beaucoup de ses clients. Georges travaille rigoureusement et a démontré sa fidélité envers L’Institution de Micro Finance HOPE Kisangani RDC en recevant 5 fois les prêts et les remboursant totalement à temps. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 8 mois et 15 ans. Quatre d’entre sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Georges K. sells chickens and pigs in Kisangani. A town which fell victim to the atrocious wars in 2000, caused by two foreign armies that scarred it, Kisangani is a main town of the Eastern province, located north of the Equator and bordering Sudan and Uganda.

Georges raises livestock and sells it as well. He makes his sales in the central market of the town. His business supports his family and helps him prepare for his children's future. His ambition is to create a transport business which is indispensable for Kisangani. Presently, his business generates a profit of US$ 90 per week. With this next loan, he intends to expand his business by buying foodstuffs requested by many of his customers.

Georges works very hard and has demonstrated his trustworthiness to the Micro-finance Institution HOPE Kisangani DRC by receiving 5 previous loans and reimbursing them in a timely manner. He is married and the father of 5 children whose ages vary from 8 months to 15 years. Four of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase chickens and pigs for resale to increase his income

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jacqueline Fernández de 38 años de edad, mujer esforzada que logra como ganarse la vida para apoyar a sus tres hijos ya que estudian y no tiene el apoyo de su papa, reside en el Reparto Shick, trabaja en una expresa privada. Y también  tiene juego de video para lograr otros ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades diarias. A su hermano le compro aparatos eléctricos para poner el negocio, con este préstamo comprara televisores para agrandar el negocio y dar un mejor servicio al cliente. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que obtendrá con nuevos aparatos para desarrollarse en sus negocios, lo cual permitirá a sus hijos un ingreso para seguir con los estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Jacqueline Fernández is 38 years old. She struggles to make a living to support her three school-aged children because she does not receive assistance from their father. Doña Jacqueline lives in Reparto Shick and works for a private company. She also operates a video game parlor in order to earn extra income to cover her daily needs. Her brother bought the video game equipment, so she will use her loan to buy televisions so that she can enlarge her business and provide better customer service. Doña Jacqueline thanks the Institution for providing her the benefit of developing her business through this new equipment. This will provide income for her children to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase television sets

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su pequeña hija de 8 años en su casa propia. Hace 4 años emprendió el negocio de la venta de cervezas en su misma casa, para lo cual Isabel se cerciora de conocer a la persona a quién le vende. Asimismo lleva su producto a diferentes eventos sociales de su localidad. Adicionalmente, vende ropa interior en la feria comercial de su ciudad. Con estas actividades logra solventar los gastos de su familia, por lo que su próxima meta es incrementar su mercadería para a su vez, aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la segunda oportunidad de crédito que tiene con MFP, ella ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y motiva la responsabilidad en las demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y ropa al por mayor, directamente de la fábrica.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and lives with her 8-year-old daughter. Four years ago, she started selling beer from her home, which has helped her get to know her customers. She also sells beer at various social events in her community. In addition to selling beer, Isabel sells underwear at her local swap meet. This is how she has been able to earn a living for her family. She would like to increase the amount of merchandise she has so she can increase her sales. This is Isabel’s second loan with MFP. She has been punctual with her payments and this in turn motivates other members of her communal bank to be punctual. She will buy boxes of beer wholesale directly from the factory with her loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchanise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 31 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, con su esposo y su hijo de 5 años. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de cigarros, los cuales distribuye en los principales establecimientos y tiendas de su localidad. Para ello, su herramienta de transporte es una camioneta arrendada que su esposo se encarga de conducir y ella de repartir la mercadería. Su trabajo es durante todo el día, pero sus ganancias son muy gratificantes, lo cual la motivan a planificar a futuro la adquisición de una movilidad propia. Esta es la sexta oportunidad de crédito que tiene con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes de su banco comunal más puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitado será invertido en la compra de más mercadería para abastecer a sus clientes con mayor rapidez.
texts.en:
Leticia, 31, lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She lives with her husband and their five year old son. She has been selling cigarettes for four years. She distributes them in the main establishments and stores in her area. Her husband drives a rented van to deliver the merchandise. Her work is all day long, but her earnings are very gratifying. They motivate her to plan for acquiring her own transportation in the future. This is her sixth loan opportunity with MFP. She is one of the members of her community bank who is most responsible with her payments. The loan she is asking for is to buy more merchandise to stock her customers more rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six sons. Some are still in school while others are learning trades. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods in Kumasi. Janet has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de carne y queso, productos que reparte en el principal mercado de la ciudad donde radica. Diariamente realiza la comercialización, mientras que los días jueves de cada semana viaja a su tierra natal para abastecerse de quesos. Adicionalmente, también vende truchas (pez de agua dulce), las cuales compra frescas y las vende durante el fin de semana. Debido a la calidad de sus productos sus ventas está aumentando poco a poco y esto la anima a continuar con su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, Maritza está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite crecer progresivamente. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de quesos y baldes nuevos, que es donde transporta sus productos. Asimismo, quiere incursionar en la venta de otros comestibles, por lo que también comprará menestras, fideos y aceite.
texts.en:
Maritza is 21 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old son in the home of a relative. For the past 7 years she has sold meat and cheese which she distributes in her home town's main market. She sells her product daily but on each Thursday of the week she travels to her home town to replenish her supply of cheese. She also sells fresh-water trout which she buys fresh and sells on the week-end. Because of the good quality of her products, her sales have been increasing little by little which encourages her to continue her work. This is her third loan from MFP and she is very happy to be part of the communal bank because it permits her to progressively grow. The loan she is requesting now will be used to buy cheeses and new buckets which she uses to transport her products. She also wants to expand into the sales of other foodstuffs so she will also be purchasing vegetables, pasta and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en la casa de sus suegros.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes (tipo de falda regional) y paralelamente vende quesos de forma ambulante por las calles de su ciudad. Vilma acondicionó en su casa un pequeño espacio donde realiza los bordados, los cuales son solicitados generalmente durante las festividades del pueblo. En ocasiones, sus hijas la apoyan en esta tarea, la cual es un negocio rentable, porque debido al detalle del bordado, puede obtener buenas ganancias por cada falda. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Vilma es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal y también una mujer perseverante en el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos para sus bordados y mayor cantidad de quesos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jules

texts.fr:
Jules K. 35 ans, est habitant de la ville de Kisangani en RDC situé au nord de la ligne de l’Equateur, dans la province Orientale qui est frontalière avec le Soudan et l’Ouganda. Cette ville commence à reprendre progressivement sa vie économique après des meurtriers affrontements causés par deux armées étrangères en 2000 an.
Jules est vendeur des matelas à Kisangani depuis 1998 qu’il a interrompu en 2000 an à la suite des guerres. Il a repris l’activité après les hostilités et vend actuellement dans le marché central de la ville. Cette affaire constitue la source principale de revenu pour sa famille et l’avenir de ses enfants. Il est client fidèle de l’Institution de Micro Finance HOPE Kisangani RDC, qui a obtenu 5 fois les prêts et les a tous remboursés correctement. Le prochain prêt lui servira d’acheter des matériaux de fabrication des matelas pour répondre à la demande des clients et augmenter le revenu. Actuellement, l’affaire lui produit un bénéfice de $120 par semaine. Il compte évoluer avec les crédits de Kiva à travers HOPE RDC pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin des matelas. Jules est marié et père de 3 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 8 ans et deux seulement vont à l’école.

loans.use: acheter des matériaux de fabrication de plus de matelas pour répondre à la demande de ses clients et augmanter le revenu de son activité

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Naboth's Group

texts.en:
M. Naboth is the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is 44 years old and a businessman involved in agriculture. He has been in this business for 20 years and the experience has made his work easy, hence winning him more customers. He is able to make a profit of about 200,000/= monthly and it is from this that he is able to pay school fees for his 6 children and 3 dependents plus saving for his children’s upkeep.

Naboth has been able to start up poultry and piggery businesses and the loan is going to help him expand these two businesses further by increasing the number of birds (chickens) and pigs, as well as buying more feed for their rapid growth.

loans.use: Buying more chickens and pigs plus their feed

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and one daughter, who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband who is a farmer provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a petty trader. She sells underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Adwoa procures her goods in bales from Accra. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy more goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles for resale

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Don Pedro de 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, viudo y con un hijo el cual es independiente, su negocio es la elaboración de repostería el cual ha sido el negocio de su familia, el necesita hacer compra de quipos nuevo para elaborar las repostería rica que distribuye en las diferentes pulpería, el tiene un vehiculo donde se traslada a repartir el pan pero esta en mal estado el cual el crédito va destinado a los gastos del vehiculo para seguir ofreciendo sus productos y poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Da las gracias Afodenic ya que se ha beneficiado mucho con estos créditos, anteriormente habitaba en chontales Juigalpa y al trasladarse a Managua opto por seguir con la institución por los beneficios que ha logrado para sobresalir adelante.

loans.use: pagar la reparacion de su vehiculo que es donde ofrece sus productos

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is forty-six years old. He is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Godwin is a petty trader. He sells charcoal. He supplies it to retailers in his community and treks to supply it in other communities. Godwin has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to expand his business. He is hopeful to give all his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena Fermín de 49 años de edad, casada, reside junto con su familia en Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposo de desempeña como supervisor de vigilancia, sus tres hijos  dos mayores y uno menor que estudia la secundaria, los dos mayores trabajan en una zona franca. El negocio de la señora Maria es la venta de joya que desde hace diez año inicio con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su salario es bajo, con capital propio comenzó. Con este crédito comprara joyas y ropa nueva para incrementar el inventario y las ventas. Da las gracias Afodenic por lograr el crecimiento ya que son cinco ciclos que ha prestado y lo ha distribuido en la inversión para mejora a su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elena F. is 49 years old, married, and lives with her family in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a security guard supervisor and they have two adult children who work in the free zone and one minor who is studying secondary school. Ten years ago Maria used her savings to start her jewelry sales business in order to help her husband meet household expenses since his salary is low. With this loan she will buy jewelry and clothing to sell thereby increasing her inventory and her sales. She thanks Afodenic for helping her grow since she has been involved in five loan cycles which she has been able to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de TAXI-MOTO.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos  Cárdenas de 56 años de edad, es un hombre luchador en la vida, trabaja en servicios de seguridad, anteriormente era asistente de cartera en las instituciones estatales del gobierno, reside en el barrio Jorge Dimitrou, su esposa trabaja en la cocina para apoyar a su familia ya que tienen tres hijos y los tres estudian, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para construir un cuarto y poder tener mejor comodidad. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa y sobre todo dar los estudios a los clientes. Agradece Afodenic por la oportunidad del préstamo el cual gozara junto con su familia de las mejoras.

loans.use: Comaprar materiales de construccion para construir un cuarto

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. All are out of school and working. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. Afia lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Afia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
la sra. Luz Idalia V. tiene 34 años de edad, viven en union libre con el sr. Pompilio Ayala.
su compañero de hogar se dedica al oficio de la fotografia y Luz V. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas.
tienen tres hijos y todos estudian. 
ademas de producir tortillas tambien vende charamuscas y paletas. como la zona donde ellos viven es muy caliente por eso se venden mucho estos helados.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas maiz, leña, cal y agua ya que el maiz y la leña estan subiendo de precio. todo lo quiere comprar al por mayor asi le saca mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia V. is 34 years old and lives with Pompilio Ayala, her common law partner, who is a photographer. Luz makes and sells tortillas. They have three children who are students. Besides the manufacture and sale of tortillas she also sells candy and popsicles since the area in which they live is very hot and these cold snacks are very popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more corn, fire wood, lye and water because both the corn and fire wood have been increasing in price and she would like to buy everything wholesale so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, fire wood, lye, water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Georgina Marisela

texts.es: Doña Georgina L. es una señora trabajadora que desde horas tempranas se le vanta para realizar sus oficios de ama de casa para luego, elaborar los nacatamales que es su negocio. Tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada y su esposo es ingeniero civil, con tres hijos que estudian, anteriormente ella vendía sopa, inicio a vender comida con la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir la necesidad de su familia. Con este crédito es su sexta solicitud  que invertirá en la compra de azulejos, madera, cielo raso y piso, para elaborar un desayunador  y poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, agradeciendo a la institución por los logros alcanzados.
texts.en:
Georgina L. is a hard-working woman who begins her day early in the morning to complete her chores as a housewife so that she can then make tamales to sell. She is 37 years old, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua and is married to her civil engineer husband. They have three children who are full-time students. In the past she sold soup but then began selling meals in order to increase her profits to meet family needs. With this loan, her sixth, she intends to buy building materials: tile, wood, dry wall, flooring, to build a breakfast nook to better serve her customers. She is grateful to the institution for goals met.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials, tile and dry wall, to remodel her breakfast nook in her dining room.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to help her husband to be able to provide for the family.

Gladys lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Gladys has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
Loa socios son miembros del banco comunal “KILLA”, Killa es un nombre quechua, que significa traducido al castellano, Luna; que fuera la esposa del Dios Sol, para nuestros antepasados los inkas.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, los socios se dedican a diversas actividades, como por ejemplo algunas socias realizan llamadas a celulares nacionales, una socia es profesora de escuela, una pareja de esposos socios tienen un restaurante turístico en la calle recoleta, los otros socios tienen tienda abarrotes, venden licores en el centro comercial molino, todos los socios desean el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios  y así seguir apostando en el crecimiento de sus múltiples negocios.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos con el préstamo y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo programado.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo para reinvertir en sus negocios.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. de 41años de edad, casada, reside junto con su familia en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad que cursan la secundaria, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada que inicio hace dieciséis años para sobresalir adelante con los gastos de la familia,  comenzó con ahorros y prestamos el cual le ha sido de mucho beneficios por lograr mantener las ventas, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual con este comprara pacas de ropa y uniformes de estudiantes ya que se acerca las fiestas patrias de Nicaragua y los padres comprar uniformes bastante. Espera poder tener su propia tienda. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados el cual se ha beneficiado en mantener su clientela y ganancias la cual ha sastifacido sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 41 years old, married, living with her family in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works for a private enterprise and they have two children: a 12- and an 18-year-old, who are in secondary school. She sells used clothing, a business she has been involved with for the past 16 years and which earns her funds with which to help pay household expenses. She began with her own savings as well as loans that have allowed her to maintain her sales. This is her 8th cycle with Afodenic and she intends to use these funds to buy wholesale bales of used clothing as well as school uniforms since Nicaragua's national holiday is fast approaching and this is when parents traditionally purchase school uniforms. She hopes to have her own store and thanks the institution for the growth attained to date which has allowed her to keep her client base and earn profits that have helped her meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina N. is married and has two children. She has received some formal education. Sabina sells porridge at Yamoransa, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a carpenter. Sabina uses her income to pay for feeding her family and also paying utility bills.

Sabina will use the loan to purchase millet from Techiman and sugar to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to save towards building a house and also for educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase millet from Techiman and sugar to prepare porridge for sale

loans.name: Deysi Milagro

texts.es:
la sra. Deysi Milagro C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 4 años de tener su pulperia, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y su hogar, este negocio es el unico que la a sostenido por estos ultimos años, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder inyectarle capital a su negocio ya que no lo tiene bien surtido y quiere hacerlo crecer.
uno de sus mayores sueños es ver graduados a sus hijos de la universidad y que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
Deysi nos comento que para ella sus hijos es lo mas preciado que tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Deysi Milagro C. dedicates herself to the sale of popularly consumed products; she has owned a small convenience store for 4 years. Thanks to this business she has been able to move her family and home forward in life; this business has been her only source of financial support these past few years. Currently she needs a loan to be able to inject capital into her business, given that it is not well stocked and she would like her business to grow.

One of her biggest dreams is to see her children graduate from university, and that they become professionals and good men. Deysi comments that to her, her children are the most precious things that she has in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soaps, churros, pills, drinks, razors, toilet paper, batteries, eggs, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, sweets, play balls, gas, sanitary napkins, soups, consommés, spices, and salt.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paskazia's Group

texts.en:
T. Paskazia is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 49 years old and a widow with 4 children aged 20 – 1 year; 3 are in school. Paskazia has had a little grocery shop in Kizinda town for 10 years but moves to different markets in Bushenyi to serve more customers. She is able to make 30,000/= as weekly profit, and she has hopes of owning a store in a big town and educating all her children through to the University.

Paskazia sells general merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and much more, and she needs a loan to be able to purchase more goods for her grocery store for resale. She is a hard-working and determined lady who moves with all her goods to the different markets where people converge once every week.

loans.use: Buying more goods for resale

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel de 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltera con tres hijos de 7, 13 y 18 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y los dos menores estudian su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años administra, difícil ya que no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijos, con este préstamo que esta haciendo es para comprar granos básicos, carne, golosinas y otros productos para incrementar las ventas y poder tener mejores utilidades. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de incrementar el inventario de su negocio el cual traerá beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 36 years old and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is single and has three children ages 7, 13, and 18; the eldest works and the two younger children study. She has run a small convenience store for many years, which has been difficult given that she does not have help from the father of her children. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, meat, candies, and other products to increase her sales and earn better profits. She thanks the institution for the opportunity to increase the inventory of her business, which will bring benefits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, candies, and other products.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la joven Karla Patricia M. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella al 100%.
ella se dedica a vender productos para uso personal como ser desodorantes, lociones, perfumes, talcos, aceites, shampoos, acondicionadores, esmaltes de uña, cremas para pies. etc.
Karla tiene 3 años de tener su negocio, con el cual ha logrado traer a la mayoria de sus clientes por su buena atencion y la calidad de su producto.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, tiene que viajar a la frontera entre Honduras - El Salvador para comprar dicha mercaderia ya que en ese sector es mas barato todo.

loans.use: compra de desodorantes, cremas, lociones, perfumes, quita esmaltes, shampoo, acondicionador de pelo, esmaltes de uña, aceite para cuerpo, talcos

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresa  De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Teresa T. es una mujer esforzada  que desde joven a trabajado para ayudar a sus padres primeramente y ahora a su familia, procreo cuatro hijos de 13, 15,17 y 23 años los cuales solo uno estudia, su ex esposo es mecánico y le ayuda para la alimentación ya que no están juntos, ella trabaja en servicios domestico pero en la casa que trabaja no tiene perspectiva es por eso en cuando recoja unos ahorro quiere poner un negocio de cosmético para poder estar en la casa y tener mas orden y obtener mejores ingresos, este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento arena y otros materiales para comienza hacer el embaldosado  y una cera de su casa para estar en mejores condiciones y con una mejor presentación. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios para hacer las mejoras a su casa el cual su familia esta contenta de estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa T. is a woman who puts much effort into everything she does. When she was younger, she had to work in order to help her parents. Now she does the same in order to support her own family. She has four children (ages 23, 17, 15, and 14), of which only one is a student. Her ex-husband is a mechanic and helps with the food bill even though they are no longer together. She currently works as a housemaid, but she doesn’t see any future in that job. When she has enough money saved, she wants to start a cosmetics business from home so that she can be in control and earn a better income.

Doña Teresa is requesting her fourth loan from AFODENIC. She will purchase sand, cement, and other building materials needed to install a ceramic tile floor. This will improve the condition of her home and make it more presentable. She thanks the Institution for providing these benefits so that she can make improvements that are suited for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a ceramic tile floor

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia A. sells clothes and also runs a mini-restaurant in Asebu Yamoransa. Emilia has received no education. She is single and has no children. Emilia has been selling clothes and also running a mini-restaurant since 2003. She is responsible for paying utility bills, paying rent and also feeding her family. Her loan will be used to purchase spices and other food supplies for her food preparation and sale and also to buy clothes in larger quantity for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase spices and other food supplies for her food preparation and sale

loans.name: Delia Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia Delia, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tiene 53 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos (30, 27, 11), la socia es conviviente y alterna sus actividades el hogar con la docencia, ella es profesora y tiene una peluquería en Pisac, ella administra su peluquería por las tardes y en las mañanas su hija le ayuda, también tienen a otras dos señoritas que trabajan con ella, la socia requiere el dinero en razón de invertir en la implementación de su peluquería.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Delia belongs to the communal bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, located in the Taray district, one hour from the city of Cusco.

She is 53 years old, and has three children (30, 27, 11). She lives with her partner and goes between household duties and teaching. She is a teacher and has a hairdresser's shop in Pisac. She manages her shop in the afternoons, and in the mornings her daughter helps her. She also has two other young women who work with her. She needs a loan to invest in the running of her hairdresser's shop.
