Delia is grateful for and values the money lent to her, and promises to comply with the monthly payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run her hairdresser's shop

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: La señora Zoila Ortiz de 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, madre soltera y trabajadora, logro tener su propio negocio el cual comenzó con un poco de ahorros y con préstamo,, logro tener un cafetín en el colegio lleva diez años administrándolo, para esto metió una carta de solicitud al colegio para que le permitieran estar con su cafetín lo que logro positivo a si como las ventas son buenas ya que siempre están los alumnos como maestros se siente contenta hasta hoy y con el apoyo de Afodenic ha logrado para incrementar su inventario es su tercer ciclo, el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa y poder gozar junto con su familia. sus planes es poder ayudar a su hijo que sea profesional para que goce de mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila Ortiz is a 48 year old hardworking single mother who lives in the neighborhood annex of Villa Venezuela. She has an 18 year old son. With her savings and the help of a loan, Sra. Zoila started a cafeteria at the local high school and has been in business now for 10 years. Ever since she received permission from the school to start her business, she has been experiencing good sales and the students and faculty are pleased with her service.

With the help of AFODENIC, she has managed to increase the inventory for her business. For her third loan cycle, she is requesting to buy construction materials so that she can make improvements to her home that she and her family will be able to enjoy. She hopes to encourage her son to become a professional so that he will be able to live in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara W. is single and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Barbara sells cooked rice in Yamoransa, which she has done since 2004. Barbara uses her income to pay for feeding her family and also for utility bills.

Barbara will use the loan to purchase to buy bags of rice, tomatoes, and other ingredients to cook and sell at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Barbara plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, tomatoes and other ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Betti Esther

texts.es:
La socia Betti, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, ella alterna sus labores del hogar con la artesanía, lleva hasta el mirador cada mañana sus productos para venderlos a los turistas, la socia aprovecha que este es un sitio obligado de paso para todos los visitantes que van en dirección a Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y de hay continuarán a Machupicchu, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanía para la venta.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Betti belongs to the communal bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, located in the Taray district, one hour from the city of Cuzco.

She is 28 years old, and is the single mother of a six-year-old boy. She goes between her household duties and crafts. Every morning she brings her products to El Mirador in Cuzco to sell them to tourists. She takes advantage of this site because all the visitors to Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo and Machu Picchu have to pass through. She needs this loan to buy a greater quantity of crafts to sell.

Betti is grateful for the money lent to her, and promises to make all her monthly payments, in agreement with the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in crafts

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia tiene 40 años, es madre de 4 hijas, quienes aun estudian en el colegio y junto a su esposo viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado de río de todas las variedades y tamaños en un puesto informal del mercado. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 11:00am y esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 9 años. En algunas oportunidades cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas, quien la ayuda en la atención de los clientes. Y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una buena atención a las personas, sobre todo a sus caseras (clientes regulares). Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable porque sus ingresos son diarios y compra el pescado directamente del puerto fluvial a un precio menor, por lo que obtiene mejores ganancias. A Elia le va muy bien, por lo que posteriormente quiere llegar a exportar este producto a otros lugares que desconocen lo sabroso de los pescados de agua dulce. Con este, Elia ya  tiene 8 préstamos con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son todos los integrantes son puntuales y se comprenden entre sí. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pescado, para ello usará 500 soles; con lo restante mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor tranquilad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Elia is 40 years old, married, and lives in her own home. She and her husband have 4 daughters who attend high school. Elia sells river fish of all varieties and sizes from her post in the informal market. Her work schedule runs from 6am to 11am and she has been doing this for the past 9 years. Occasionally one of her daughters will come with her to help tend to the customers. What she likes most about her job is that she gets to sell and take good care of people, especially her regular clients. In addition, her business is very profitable because she earns a daily income and gets better returns because she buys her fish directly from the river port at a lower price. Elia’s business is doing very well and sometime later she wants to export her product to other places that have not experienced the taste of freshwater fish.

Elia already has 8 previous loans with MFP. She loves working with her Communal Bank because all the members are punctual with their payments and understand one another. She will designate 500 soles to purchase more fish. With the rest of her loan, she plans to build a kiosk so that she can conduct business more peacefully and securely.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional inventory of fish & construction of a kiosk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has two children. She has received no schooling. Nana sells groceries at Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Nana uses her income for educating her children, feeding them, and also for the clothing of her family.

Nana will use the loan to purchase the groceries she sells in large quantities for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save towards building a house for her family.

loans.use: purchase the groceries she sells in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de  (14, 5) años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, ella vende sus productos en el mirador de Taray a los turistas, la socia aprovecha que este es un sitio obligado de paso para todos los visitantes que van en dirección a Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y de hay continuarán a Machupicchu, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanía para la venta.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Señor de la Agonía de Taray Communal Bank, located in the district of Taray, an hour away from Cusco. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has two children aged fourteen and five. She goes back and forth between her household activities and her handicrafts business. She sells her products to tourists at a scenic overlook in Taray, taking advantage of visitors stopping on their way to Calca, Pisac, Urubamba and Ollantaytambo and from there, continuing on to Machu Picchu. She needs a loan to purchase more handicrafts to sell. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her repayment obligations in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. sells roasted meat popularly known as kebab Cape coast. Ama has received no formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama has been selling roasted meat popularly known as kebab since 2007. She is responsible for paying of school fees and also feeding her family. Her loan will be used to buy grass cutters, antelopes and other live stock to prepare the kebab for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a new house for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy grass cutters, antelopes and other live stock to prepare the kebab for sale.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Don Angel tiene 50 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de productos plasticos como ser pailas, baldes, papeleras, canastas tortilleras, ganchos para ropa, rayadores, pascones etc.
tiene varios años de vender su producto en un mercado de la ciudad de comayaguela, los dias que vende es de lunes a sabado. desde muy temprano se levanta para ir a su negocio.
el vive con su esposa y su hija de 8 años, su hija esta en la escuela cursando el 2 grado de educacion primaria.
su esposa lo apoy a a vender el producto cuando es temporada alta.
a don Angel desde niño le han gustado las ventas, el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio y asi obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Don Angel is 50 years old and sells plastic products such as basins, buckets, wastebaskets, hampers, clothes hangers, storage containers, etc. He has been selling these products for several years from a market in the city of Comayaguela. His business is open Monday through Saturday. He wakes up early in the morning so that he can leave for work.

He lives with his wife and 8 year old daughter, who is a 2nd grade student. His wife helps him sell products during the tourist season. Since he was a young man, Don Angel has enjoyed sales. He is requesting a loan to restock his business so that he can generate higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is from Yamoransa, a town near Cape Coast, Ghana. Her husband is a fisherman, and they have two children. She is responsible for paying school fees and feeding her family.

Hawa has been selling bags of rice since 2001. Her loan will be used to buy rice in bulk for resale at the market. She hopes to apply her business profits towards building a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale at the market.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Narcisa de 57 años de edad, reside en el Reparto los Martínez en la en la capital de Managua, procreo cuatro hijos  todos mayores de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde diecisiete años administra la cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo, solo vendiendo granos básicos, ahora vende una variedad de productos, y con la alternativa de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, dos hijos le ayudan económicamente. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, golosinas entre otros para ofrecer a su clientela la variedad, lo cual espera que le genere mejores ganancia y la captación de clientes nuevos. Sus planes es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo y por lograr sus objetivos.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, carnes y golosinas

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: La señora  Maria Hernández de 44 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos tres estudian y el mayor trabaja y la apoya con los gastos, su negocio es la venta de fritanga que desde hace siete años esta vendiendo por la mañana hace los oficios en su casa para luego prepararse para hacer los alimentos para vender, este negocio lo inicio con fondos que su hijo dio y ahorros y prestamos que Afodenic dio, esta es su sexta solicitud el cual comprara compras variada para preparar los alimentos para la venta como : carnes, plátanos, granos básicos, productos lácteos entre otros, para ofertar variedad de alimentos a sus cliente y poder captar nuevos clientes. Sus planes es poder mejorar el bajarete donde vende la comida para dar un mejor servicio. Da las gracias a la institución por permitir su crecimiento y desarrollo con su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar carnes,platanos, granos basicos para preparar los alimentos

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: La señora Adela Ramírez de 33 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos que procreo todos estudian, reside en el barrio Isaías Gomez en la capital de Managua,  su negocio es la venta de abarrote en donde vende una variedad de productos, antes se dedicaba ala venta de fritanga. Sus planes es poder poner una venta surtida de productos en su casa, entre poder dar estudios  a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, canela, achotes, manzanillas entre otros productos para ofertar a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de los prestamos lo cual han sido de mucho beneficios para mejoras a su negocio como para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela Ramírez is 33 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all students. She lives in the neighborhood of Isaías Gomez in the capital city of Managua. Sra. Adela operates a grocery store where she sells a variety of products. Previously she sold fried foods. Her plans include putting a fully stocked store in her home. This will enable her to pay for her children to have a good education.

With this loan, she will purchase basic grains, cinnamon, annatto, chamomile, and other products to offer to her customers. She thanks AFODENIC for providing the opportunity to borrow and the many benefits that have improved her business as well as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, cinnamon, annatto, chamomile, and other products

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two teenage sons. He lives in Kamenka and sells office supplies, books, text books and some retail items. He has established good connections with local schools and organizations which helps him keep his sale rates pretty high all year long. Gennadyi has been working in this sphere of trade for 10 years. Currently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His net profit amounts to 3,000-5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Gennadyi is seeking a loan of 8,488 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming school year. Many students go shopping for office supplies at the markets before September 1st which is the official start of a school year in Ukraine. Gennadyi is hoping to generate extra income this season to continue growing his small business. He has an impeccable credit record and is hoping to repay the current loan without any problems as well.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies wholesale for an upcoming school year

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a son and daughter, Maxim and Anna. Their family lives in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Alexander owns a small enterprise selling groceries, cereal, noodles, etc. in the local market. He uses his small truck to transport wholesale groceries to his retail vending kiosk. His business is well known in the marketplace for reasonable and affordable prices and so attracts many customers. Alexander has been in the trade for twelve years and has learned a lot about making his business a profitable one. Presently, he has about 12,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory.

Alexander is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital. With this, he intends to generate additional income to be set aside for the education of his children, who will soon need to start thinking about college. As Alexander is an experienced businessman and a responsible father, we believe the current loan will benefit his small venture and assist his family.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Veronica Magalis

texts.es: La joven Verónica de 25 años de edad, ha sido esforzada para salir adelante en su vida desde joven inicio dando clase  de primaria en el colegio,  tiene seis años de trabajar, casada pero aun no tiene hijos, su esposo trabaja como cajero, residen en el barrio 22 de enero en la capital de Managua, sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa es por eso comprara cerámica, arena cemento para repellar su casa. Este es su segundo ciclo en  Afodenic y logrado hacer las mejoras. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando y logra la carrera de Biología ya que tiene tercer año para poder ganar mejor. Da las gracias ala institución por lograr hacer realidad sus metas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 25 years old, married, and does not have children. Her husband works as a cashier and they live in the January 22 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. This young woman has been struggling to get ahead in life. She has been working for six years and has also started taking college classes.

Verónica is about to undertake some projects to improve the infrastructure of her house. She will buy ceramic tiles, cement, and sand to repair her home. She is requesting her second loan from AFODENIC in order to make these improvements. Her plan is to continue studying and pursue a career in biology. She still has three years left before she earns her degree. She thanks the Institution for helping her realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, and ceramic tiles

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two children. His family is from Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Igor runs a small business selling women’s outerwear in a market in his home town. He launched this venture ten years ago and has managed to keep it sustainable and successful. Currently, Igor has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His gross income amounts to 25,000 Grivnyas a month.

Igor is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for his vending kiosk. His reputation is that of a hard worker and an entrepreneur who shapes his business to meet his customers’ demands. Using his profits, Igor is hoping to be able to purchase an apartment for his family, as they are now living with his in-laws.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for his kiosk

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a daughter. She lives in Kherson and runs her small business selling outer clothing items in the central market of her home town. Tatyana is very disciplined and organized. She managed to start her business from scratch and see it grow and develop in the last 6 years. Presently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas invested in her business. Her monthly income is about 9,000 Grivnyas. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 7,300 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to keep her venture running to secure stable income and meet all the needs of her family of three.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Bayardo Arsenio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo B. de 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado y con ocho hijos que su esposa procreo, todos mayores de edad, el es pensionado y formo su propio y pequeño negocio de venta de cereales que sale a vender ambulante entre los cuales vende pinolillo, cereales, cacao lo cual compra el quintal de maíz, arroz semilla de jicaro,  cacao, avena, leña para poder hacer el cereal que tomamos los Nicaragüenses, con este crédito comprar un molino para bajar el costo de producción y poder captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias ala institución por lograr sus objetivos y a si poder ayudar a sus hijos en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Sr. Bayardo B. lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur in the capital city of Managua. He is 61 years old, married, and has 8 adult children. Sr. Bayardo is a pensioner who started his own small business selling grain. He travels door-to-door selling products such as corn flour, cacao, rice, jícaro seeds, oats, and firewood (for preparing the cereal dishes consumed by most Nicaraguans).

Sr. Bayardo has requested a loan to purchase a grain mill so that he can lower his production costs and attract new customers. He thanks the Institution for helping him meet his goals so that he can help his children as much as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a grain mill

loans.name: Henry Ramon

texts.es: El jovenHenrry S. de 29 años de edad, reside en el barrio  Batahola Norte en la capital de Managua, trabajador que ha logrado invertir en su propio negocio, elabora espejos y cuadros y lleva cinco años en las ventas el cual inicio  con ahorro de su liquidación que era gestor aduanero, y esta en sociedad con su  hermano estos espejos los dejan al crédito y al contado, sus metas es poder obtener mayores clientes y ventas. Con este crédito es el quinto ciclo en Afodenic y quiere invertir en madera, cener, resina, clavos y otros productos para ejercer el trabajo, da las gracias a la institución por lograr hacer posible la producción de sus productos lo cual espera incrementar y poder ayudar a sus padres.

loans.use: Comprar madera, cener, resina y otros productos para elaborar sus productos

loans.name: Plan De Lucha Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the leader of the group Plan de Lucha (or Plan of Attack). This group has taken out loans together for three years and is looking to take out their sixth loan. They have all proven themselves to be successful entrepreneurs and look forward to growing their businesses even more. 

Hilaria runs a small corner grocery store called a colmado where she sells basic cooking supplies. With this loan she will buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Her store started out as a little hut outside her house, and with her past loans she has been able to build a more permanent structure made from cement blocks. Right now Hilaria´s house is made of wood and sheets of metal and her goal is to make enough money to build her house from cement blocks as well. 

You can help Hilaria and the rest of the members in Plan de Lucha achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Con Dedicacion Group

texts.en:
The communal loan group “Mujeres con Dedicacion” (Women with Dedication) consists of 13 members.  These women just began working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, and this will be their very first loan.  They are requesting a total of 4400 soles.  The women of “Mujeres con Dedicacion” dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures including making and selling shoes, sewing, and selling cooked food, juices, or basic grocery items.  Each plans to invest her loan in her business.

Señora Nelia T. R. is the official president of “Mujeres con Dedicacion.”  She is 52 years old and is married with one child.  She has a business making and selling beaded sandals and also earns income by recycling bottles.  Her husband works at a saw mill.  Nelia plans to invest her loan in purchasing materials such as elastic, beads, soles and other items necessary for constructing her handmade sandals.

The women of “Mujeres con Dedicacion” are pleased to have working capital to help grow their businesses, enabling them to contribute financially to their households.

loans.use: To buy materials to make beaded sandals

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.en:
Señora Sara is 63 years old.  She and her husband live with their 15-year-old adopted son.  Sara has a business making handicrafts such as earring and accessory stands, placemats, and embroidered cloths and towels.  She also hand-decorates shoes.  Her husband sells cell phones and other phone equipment.  Sara and her husband also earn income by renting rooms in their home in the city of Pucallpa.

Sara has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She plans to use this loan of 2000 soles to invest in materials for decorating shoes and also in improving the doors for the rooms that she rents.  

Sara can count on her husband’s support for her business ventures.  She and her husband are completing the construction of more rooms to rent out on the second floor of their home.  Sara also owns a piece of land outside the city where she grows plantains, maize, and fruits.  Sara’s goal is to have good earnings from this piece of land (as well as from her other business ventures) so that she can contribute to the household income.

loans.use: Materials for decorating shoes; improvement of doors for rooms for rent

loans.name: Edith Adelaida

texts.en:
Señora Edith is 65 years old.  She is a widow and has three adult children.  Edith lives in the city of Pucallpa and has a small farm along the Ucayali, the wiD. brown river that flows past the city and joins the Amazon to the north.  On her farm Edith raises chickens and ducks and also plants a variety of crops, including plantains and maize.  She works this farm together with her sisters. 
 
Edith has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  Edith invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in a home-based restaurant that she had at that time.  She plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in maintaining her farm and in food for the chickens she raises.  

Edith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support that the organization gives to low-income women.  Edith’s loans have helped her to improve her financial situation.  Edith’s goal is to increase the production of her farm.  She would like to plant other crops including yucca, beans, and rice in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Chicken feed; maintenance of a farm

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz María S., es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas, es un bankito muy sólido, solidario y unido llevan muchos años realizando prestamos y son las personas más agradecidas porque gracias a estos préstamos han logrado superarse y sacar  a sus familias adelante, brindándoles una vida digna y se encuentran muy orgullosas de sus logros, como grupo son muy alegres y extrovertidas se llevan muy bien entre todas. 

Luz vive en la panamericana norte kilómetro 7 ½  a unos 40 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es casada y aun no tiene hijos, pero pronto los piensa procrear, viven en casa propia, su esposo trabaja como chofer y se llevan muy bien creando una relación estable y armoniosa

Estudio belleza y trabaja en su rama, teniendo su propio gabinete hace 6 años, le va muy bien por que cuenta con una buena clientela, en su gabinete trabaja sola y la mejor ventaja de ser dueña de su gabinete de belleza es que trabaja con tranquilidad  y es independiente, una desventaja es la competencia que existe. 

Luz trabaja junto al bankito hace 5 años y está contenta por las capacitaciones que le han brindado de parte de la fundación, el préstamo que la fundación le entrega lo va a invertir en su gabinete por que necesita comprar algunos instrumentos para  su negocio, su meta es comprarse un carro para poder viajar a distintas partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz María S. is a member of the “Progressive Women Communal Bank”, a stable bank with supportive, close members who have been making loans for several years. The women in the Bank are very thankful because through these loans they have been able to better themselves and provide a better life for their families. They are very proud of their achievements. As a group, they are very cheerful and extroverted and get along very well with one another.

Luz lives in the North Pan American Highway (km. 7 1/2), about 40 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, is married, and even though she currently has no kids she plans to have them soon. Luz and her husband live in a house they own and her husband works as a driver. They have a stable and loving relationship.

Luz studied Beauty and makes a living in this field. She has had her own business for 6 years and is doing very well because she has a good customer base. The greatest advantage of owning her own salon is that she can work peacefully and independently. The greatest disadvantage lies in the competition that exists.

Luz has worked with the bank for 5 years and is happy with the training the Foundation has provided her. Luz will use the loan the Foundation is giving her to invest in her salon as she needs to purchase some materials. Her goal is to purchase a car so that she can use it to go to different parts of the city..

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of instruments for her beauty salon such as hair dryers, curling irons, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda is 67 years old and is married with two adult children.  She and her husband run a small grocery shop together.  They also earn income by renting out rooms in their house in the city of Pucallpa.  

Lucinda has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She will use this loan of 2000 soles to invest in her grocery shop.  Lucinda also sells handmaD. stuffed animals.  She used to spend a lot of her time sewing these toys, and even taught classes instructing others on how to make them.  Because this project was taking up so much of her time, Lucinda has stopped making her stuffed animals for the time being but continues to sell the stock that remains.     

Lucinda has had a good experience working with Manuela Ramos.  Lucinda loves to cook and eventually plans to open her own restaurant and soda fountain.  She and her husband are in the process of constructing this restaurant.

loans.use: Products for a small general store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 35 years old and is married with four children.  Celia owns a grocery shop in a small agricultural and fishing community on the banks of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Celia’s husband is a teacher.

Celia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a about year and is a member of the communal bank “Las Mariscalas.”  She has used past loans to invest in her grocery shop and plans to do the same with this loan of 1300 soles.  She will also buy gasoline to sell in the same community where she has her grocery shop.  

Celia is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with capital to work.  She is pleased to be able to help with household expenses alongside her husband.  Celia’s goal is to expand her grocery shop and offer a wider variety of products.

loans.use: Products for a small grocery shop; gasoline for sale

loans.name: Sonia Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora SONIA DEL PILAR B. E. , tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
La señora Sonia se dedica a la fabricación de calzado en el taller instalado en su casa, los mismos que lleva a vender en el centro de Trujillo.
Es socia nueva, y desea un primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como : cuero, terocal, plantillas, etc para la fabricación de su calzado.
Sonia sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial donde pueda vender el calzado que fabrica y así obtener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: compra de materiales: cuero, terocal, plantillas, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old and is married with three children.  She dedicates herself to selling juices and breakfast sandwiches from her home in the mornings.  Wilma also creates decorated skirts for sale.  Her husband works as an official in the government of Iparia, a town along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  
 
Wilma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Mariscalas.”  She used her very first loan of 200 soles (about $65) to purchase fabric for the skirts that she makes.  Wilma will invest this loan of 1500 soles in purchasing groceries for a shop that she plans to set up in the small community of Curiaca.  Curiaca is also located on the banks of the Ucayali River.
 
Wilma’s two years working with Manuela Ramos and “Las Mariscalas” have enabled her to share her business experiences with other members of her communal bank.  Wilma and the other borrowers communicate well with each other and feel a sense of solidarity as members of “Las Mariscalas.”

loans.use: Products to stock a new grocery shop.

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es:
La señora LUZ HELENA B. E. , tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco SEÑOR DE LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  4 hijos de años quienes  depende económicamente de ella, porque aún se encuentran en el colegio.
LUZ se dedica a la preparación de pan, biscochos, roscas en la panadería instalada en su casa para luego vender a los diferentes panaderos y tiendas quienes revenden el producto.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra abarrotes, tales como: harina, mantequilla, pasa, huevos, etc
Este crédito de 1000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos  como harina. mantequilla y utensilios de cocina.
LUZ sueña con ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: comprar productos  como harina, mantequilla y utensilios de cocina.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 28 years old and is married with two children, aged 11 and 9.  She has a business selling cooked food in Colonia Caco, a small agricultural and fishing community located 24 hours’ riverboat journey up the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Estela’s husband works in a saw mill.

Estela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal loan group “Las Mariscalas.”  She invested her very first loan of 200 soles (about $65) in purchasing products for her food business.  She will do the same with this loan of 1000 soles, and plans to buy sugar, rice, noodles, tuna fish and other basic food items.         

Estela’s goal is someday to have her own restaurant in the city of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, and tuna for a food business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Delfina casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Delfina vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito, además compra quesos de la comunidad de Totos y lo vende de casa en casa.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Delfina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, married and has five children. Delfina sells clothing on order that she offers to her friends and family. For the most part, her sales are on credit. She also buys cheeses from the community of Totos and sells them door-to-door. Delfina needs a loan of 600 Sols which she will use to buy cheese. Delfina dreams of her children becoming working professionals and of building up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 78 años y 3 hijos, Eugenia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. fideo, azúcar y arroz.
Eugenia sueña con ayudar a sus nietos.

loans.use: Para la compra de fideo, azúcar y arroz.

loans.name: Alicia Aylid

texts.en:
Alicia is 26 years old and is married with one child.  She has a business selling cold drinks.  Alicia’s husband is a diesel mechanic.  

Alicia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for one year and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She plans to use this loan of 1,200 soles to expand the small area where she sells her drinks.  She also wants to put up an overhang of dried palm leaves to provide shade.

Alicia feels that Manuela Ramos has provided her with a greater understanding of the importance of savings.  (Alicia must save at least 10 soles, or about $3.30, every month as part of Manuela Ramos’s mandatory savings program.)  Alicia also enjoys the business and life education sessions given by the organization’s loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.  Alicia’s goal is to someday have her own restaurant.

loans.use: To expand and improve her drink stand

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Victoria es casada, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. comida y D. las ferias compra cereales, papa, queso y animales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y cereales.
Los sueños D. Victoria son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 55-year-old married mother of 10 children. She travels to the different markets in the region to sell food and also purchase grains, potatoes, cheese and animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Victoria is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to use for the purchase of rice, sugar and grains. Her dreams are for her children to finish their studies and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and grains

loans.name: Roxana Melita

texts.es:
La señora ROXANA MELITA A. M., tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2 hijos (de  9 y 6 años) quienes  dependen  económicamente de ella.
ROXANA   se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, cerveza y agua mineral en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de agua, cerveza y gaseosas. Así como también en la compra de productos alimenticios para preparar menú (alimentos) pero por problemas de salud de su menor hija se vio obligada a dejar de prepara menú para dedicarse a cuidarla adecuadamente ya que se encontraba enferma de los riñones.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar cajas de cervezas, gaseosas y agua mineral al por mayor para vender en las fiesta que se realizaran por aniversario de su barrio.
ROXANA  sueña con tener un restaurante y así poder generar mayores ingresos que le permita solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Roxana Melita Azanero M. is 28 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Cielo II Community Bank. Roxana has a high school education and is the mother of two children, ages 9 and 6, who depend on her financially. She makes a living selling soft drinks, beer and mineral water in her home. She used her initial loan of 300 soles to invest in the purchase of those products. She also bought food products to make and sell meals, but due to the health problems of her youngest daughter, who had kidney problems, she had to drop her menu to be able to adequately care for her. With the current loan of 800 soles (approximately $275) she is requesting, Roxana plans to purchase cases of beer, soft drinks and mineral water wholesale to sell at the parties celebrating the anniversary of her neighborhood's founding. Her dream is to have a restaurant and thus be able to earn a better income, which would help him cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of beer, soft drinks and mineral water at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende locerias como ollas, platos, frazadas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante, mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Maria travels to the markets in the region where she sells cookware such as pots and pans, dishes and tablecloths, products she acquires in the city of Lima. Maria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase dishes, pots and pans. Her dreams are for her children to continue with their studies, to improve her business and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, pots and pans

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Maura es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Maura venD. alfalfa D. manera ambulatoria, sus ventas los realiza D. casa en casa, producto que adquiere D. los productores.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
Los sueños D. Maura son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She sells alfalfa door to door and acquires the product from the producers. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles (approximately $225), which she plans to use to purchase more alfalfa. Maura's dreams are to improve her business and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla y culantro.
Los sueños de Ana son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 25-year-old mother of one son and lives with her common-law husband. Ana has a post in the Nery García market where she sells vegetables at wholesale and retail every day starting at dawn. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles (approximately $425), which she plans to invest in the purchase of onion and coriander. Ana's dreams are to build a home and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase onion and coriander

loans.name: Esmirna

texts.es: Esmirna tiene 57 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que ya son independientes y trabajan, en la actualidad vive sola y en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años es propietaria de 2 motocarros, los cuales son manejados por sus hijos, quienes se dedican a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años. Estos motocarros los cuidan mucho, pues significan su sustento diario y Esmirna se encarga de la administración de las ganancias. Ella se considera una mujer muy activa por lo que no pierde el tiempo y cada vez que tiene momentos libres, generalmente por las tardes, viaja a los diferentes caseríos de su zona para comprar gallinas y pescado, los cuales posteriormente vende en el mercado de su localidad. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que sus motocarros están dejando buenas ganancias y mucho mejor si son sus hijos los choferes. Este es su 8vo préstamos con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que todos los  integrantes son muy laboriosos y hay bastante comprensión entre todos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará llantas, repuestos y otras herramientas necesarias para reparar sus motocarros y puedan trabajar en óptimas condiciones.

loans.use: Reparación de sus motocarros

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luci

texts.es: Luci tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja, quien es su principal apoyo. Con ellos también viven sus 3 hijos, que ya son adultos y trabajan. Ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas, plátanos y granos en general, los cuales lleva a vende en el mercado de su localidad, pero en caso de que le sobrase mercadería, la lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona de forma ambulante. Luci se ha establecido un horario de trabajo, que es de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde y ella misma es responsable de cumplirlo. Por otro lado, su pareja se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con el motocarro que compró Luci, mientras ella sólo se encarga de administrar las ganancias y su cónyuge vela por el cuidado mecánico de su vehículo. Hace 8 años que Luci tiene sus propios negocios y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse útil, además que con las ganancias logra generar el dinero necesario para solventar los gastos y fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son honestos y muy solidarios. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro y también comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro e incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To condition the taco stand for food sales

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Force and Power village bank. She is 44 years old and has three children who are 15, 10, and 6 and who all go to school.

Susana owns a curtain-making shop but also sells beauty products from a catalog. She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy more beauty products as well as shower and window curtains. Her dream is to build a house for herself where she can live and run her business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and shower and window curtains

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Esperanza es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Esperanza viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que comercializa en el mercado Nery. Además Esperanza teje chompas a pedido.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Esperanza son ampliar sus negocios y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de cebada, trigo.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 57 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además los días viernes viaja a la feria.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, fideo y arroz.
Los sueños D. Yolanda son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Banco Comunal Retoño. Yolanda is married, is 57 years old and has three children. Yolanda has a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells groceries, an activity which she does everyday. In addition, on Fridays she travels to the fair. Yolanda needs a loan of 800 soles ($275), money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, and rice. Yolanda's dream is that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Force and Power village bank. She is 52 years-old and has four children. Her 8 year-old son lives with her and goes to school, but the other three sons are independent. 

She has decided to start selling fruit, carbonated water, soft drinks, and beer from her house. Victoria also currently has a job as a receptionist in a hostal where she works from 8 p.m. to 8 a.m.

She is requesting a loan for 2000 soles to buy counters and cabinets for her business. Victoria’s dream is to open her shop, build up inventory options, and make enough money to put her son through university.

loans.use: buy counters and cabinets for her business

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Maria tiene una Calderia en un local alquilado, en donD. venD. caldo D. gallina, bebidas, y los días domingos venD. comida típica, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. fideo, arroz y sal.
Los sueños D. Maria son mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio y que su hija culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de fideo, arroz y sal.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Angelica es viuda, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Angélica tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. canastas y chocolates que ella misma lo prepara D. manera artesanal, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Angelica necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. canastas.
Los sueños D. Angelica son tener capital propio y brindarles estabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de canastas.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Flor es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Flor tiene un carro el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros interprovincial a la ciudad de Vilcas, además Flor tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general en Vilcas.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales construcción para el techado de su casa.
Flor sueña con comprar otro carro, construir su casa hasta el tercer piso y tener una ferretería.

loans.use: Para la compra de materiales construcción para el techado de su casa.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Zenaida es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Zenaida junto a su esposo venden madera en un local alquilado, productos que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su negocio. Zenaida tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con productos de ferretería.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calaminas, clavos,
Los sueños de Zenaida son tener una ferretería y un recreo.

loans.use: Para la compra de calaminas, clavos,

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es:
El señor Eleazar G. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos ha quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia de una vivienda por medio de Infonavit, ya que donde está vive actual mente es prestada y le están viviendo que desocupe  la casa. Ya desea que su familia hay tengan su propia casa y así tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
El señor Eleazar trabaja en una compaña en el departamento de despachador y su Espasa la señora Ana Mirna López, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada ha fuera del domicilio para no descuidar a los hijos.
Con estos ingresos planean pagar el crédito que será para que tenga su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Eleazar G. is a family man who wants to provide the best for his three children.

He is requesting a loan to make the down payment on a house through INFONAVIT (a financial services company in Mexico). His family currently lives in a rented house and they are being forced to vacate. He wants his family to have their own home so they can pursue a better quality of life.

Sr. Eleazar works for a company in the shipping department. His wife (who appears in the photo), Sra. Ana Mirna López, sells used clothing outside of their home so that she can also look after their children.

With their earnings, they plan to repay this loan which will help them secure their own housing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make the down payment on a house

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, de 1 y 10 años de edad, en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años y medio se dedica al comercio de pescado, todos los días lunes y viernes va a la terminal pesquero del lugar a comprar una variedad de pescado llamado caballa, que es muy consumido en la región, para luego procesarlo y venderlo como pescado salado en el mercado del distrito de Olmos los días sábados y domingos.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer de autos que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros y lo percibido por ambos sirve para solventar los gastos económicos de su hogar; poco a poco han llegado a comprar un lote de terreno y construir su casa que aún no está terminada,.

Por este motivo ella está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en una ampliación de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para procesarlo, venderlo; a la vez, generarse los recursos suficientes que le permitan terminar de construir su hogar.

Maritza goza de muy buenas referencias laborales, por lo que fue recomendada por muchos clientes de nuestra Institución que laboran en su misma actividad y que conocen de su responsabilidad y su entrega por sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 30 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (ages 10 and 1) in the district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For two and a half years, she has worked as a fish merchant. Every day, Monday through Friday, she goes to the fishing terminal to purchase mackerel, which is widely consumed in the region. She processes it and sells it as “pescado salado” (salted fish) at the market in Olmos District every Saturday and Sunday.

Her husband works as a chauffeur who provides transportation services to passengers. They both contribute to the household income. Over time they were able to save enough money to purchase a plot of land and start construction of a house that has not yet been finished.

Maritza is applying for her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 800 soles so that she can expand her business. She plans to buy more fish for processing and resale so that she can generate sufficient income and complete the construction of her home.

Maritza has very good work references, since she was recommended by many existing clients of our Institution who are in the same business as her. They know that she is responsible and capable of succeeding.  

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mackerel for processing & resale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos que son su mayor inspiración de salir adelante y vive con su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo maderera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que realiza en su casa. Adicionalmente, se asoció con su esposo en el negocio de la compra y venta de madera. Por otro lado, lo que le gusta de su trabajo de costura es que sus clientes tienen confianza de su buena labor y la recomiendan mucho. Además le es rentable porque cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes desde el momento en que inició su negocio, sin embargo, con lo que obtiene mayores ganancias es con el negocio de la venta de madera. Para un futuro cercano, Nilda quiere alquilar un local para instalar una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y  lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrante se entienden, son amigos y hay mucha comunicación. Del dinero que viene solicitando; 1000 soles usará para la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales y lo restante lo invertirá en su negocio de venta de madera.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo de 4 añitos de edad, quien es su mayor motivación para seguir adelante. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera a las distintas empresas que la requieren para hacer diversos trabajos de construcción. Para ello, una vez por semana, Roy tiene que viajar por los distintos caseríos de su zona para comprar la madera y aprovecha ese viaje para adquirir otros productos como pescado, aves y cerdos para venderlos en la ciudad. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 3 años y le va muy bien, pues lo que más le gusta es que trabaja solo, sin la presión de un jefe, además que su negocio le resulta rentable porque la madera mantiene su precio y ya tiene compradores estables. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal porque se siente cómodo y porque hay mucho compañerismo entre todos los integrantes. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más madera para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Roy is 31 years old and lives with his partner and mother of their 4 year old son, who is his biggest motivation to keep going. He buys lumber and sells it to various companies that need it for their construction jobs. In order to do this, Roy travels to different villages in his area to buy lumber as well as other products such as fish, poultry, and pigs to sell in the city. Roy has been in business for 3 years and is doing very well. What he likes most about his job is working alone because it comes without the pressure of a boss. His business remains profitable because the price of wood has remained stable and he already has an established clientele.

This is Roy’s 5th loan with MFP. He likes working with his Communal Bank because there is great camaraderie among all the members and he feels comfortable with them. He will be using his loan to buy more lumber to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more lumber for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus hermanas en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la agricultura y hace un mes y medio ha  sembrado camote en un terreno de una hectárea ubicado a pocos minutos de la ciudad, de esta actividad depende su sustento y el de los suyos, él trabaja incansablemente de sol a sol para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario y puedan vivir dignamente.

Su cultivo necesita mantenimiento urgente y él no tiene los recursos para comprar los fertilizantes y foliares que necesita es por ello que está solcitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan continuar con el cuidado de su cultivo.

Mariano tiene muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, tanto de la ciudad como del campo, los cuales lo consideran una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mariano is 61 years old, single, and lives with his sisters in the city of Ferreñafe, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has dedicated most of his life to agriculture. A year and a half ago, he began growing sweet potatoes on a hectare of land he owns just minutes away from the city. This activity supports him financially. He works tirelessly all day so that his family does not lack the basic necessities and can live with dignity.

His crops need urgent maintenance, but he cannot afford to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients. For this reason, he is making his first request to our Institution for a loan of 1000 soles so that he can proceed with the necessary steps to ensure a good harvest.

Mariano has very good references from his neighbors, both in the city and from the countryside. They consider him to be a very responsible and hardworking individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & plant nutrients for his sweet potato crop

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 62 años, es una mujer admirable, ya que a su edad es muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con su esposo, quien es carpintero y con la última de sus 6 hijos, quien es estudiante. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en todas las variedades y para los diferentes géneros, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Con esta labor está solventando los gastos estudiantiles de su hija, a quien espera verla, más adelante como una buena profesional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con varias personas y sobre todo aprender mucho sobre el negocio, pues así se siente útil ante la sociedad. Por otro lado, su negocio le es rentable porque le compran constantemente, en especial las personas que no tienen acceso a las tiendas de la ciudad, porque Trinidad vive cerca de una zona muy pobre, por lo que vende sus prendas a bajo precio. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda grande de ropa. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es todos los integrantes son personas con mucha responsabilidad, confiables y solidarios. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 62 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. The youngest child still lives at home and is a student. Her husband works as a carpenter. Trinidad is an admirable and hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has operated a home-based business selling clothing of different types and styles. Her income helps cover the education costs of her daughter, whom she hopes will become a successful professional. What Trinidad enjoys most about her job is the chance to interact with different people and continue learning about her business. She feels like she is a useful member of society. Her business remains profitable because her customers buy from her constantly, especially those who do not have access to stores in the city. Because she lives in a poor area, Trinidad sells her clothing at low prices. She hopes to open a large clothing store in the future.

Trinidad is taking her 8th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank because all the members are responsible, trustworthy, and caring. She will be using her loan to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Elisa Group

texts.es:
Ruby R. Sigueñas Tiene un negocio de nombre STG dedicado al bañado de metales, carbón y plástico, ella se inicia en este trabajo ayudando a su padre, antes de realizar esto ella se dedicaba ala costura y a sus estudios de administración, actualmente forma parte del grupo ALCOM SANTA ELISA ubicado en los olivos Perú.
Con solo 30 años y mucho esfuerzo ha logrado implementar su negocio adquiriendo para este fin algunas maquinas que le serán de mucha utilidad para seguir expandiéndose, por otro lado para ella también es muy importante la continuación de sus estudios, es por ello que piensa abrir  un negocio de  costura para de esta forma ayudarse mucho mas  y
Con el préstamo que le otorgara EDAPROSPO quiere comprar una LAPTOP, considerando que es esencial y de mucha ayuda para la culminación de su carrera de administración.


* Ruby R. muy sonriente en medio de las socias sentadas.
texts.en:
Ruby R. Sigueñas has a business called STG that plates metals, carbons and plastics. She started this job helping her father and previously had made a living sewing and studying administration. Currently she is part of the Alcom Santa Elisa group located in Los Olivos, Peru. At 30 years old and with a lot of effort she has been able to implement her business by acquiring some machines that will be very useful in continuing to expand. On the other hand, it is very important to Ruby to continue her studies, which is why she plans to open a sewing business because that will help her a lot more. With the loan authorized by Kiva partner EDAPROSPO, she plans to purchase a laptop, which she considers essential and a great help in finishing her administration degree. * Ruby is the one with a wide smile in the middle of the seated members.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo L., no está solicitando un préstamo escolar para poder pagarle los estudios a su hijo ya que va a entrar a la preparatoria y el no cuenta con en esté momento para pagar la colegiatura y comprar el uniforme.
 Don  Alfredo trabaja en una maquiladora como supervisor de mantenimiento, esté es le ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para poder pagar esté crédito que le ayudara a que su hijo entre ha estudiar.

loans.use: Pago de colegiatura y uniformes

loans.name: Leopoldo Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Leopoldo Chavarría D.  es una persona que siempre a buscado el bienestar de su familia, con los años fue juntando dinero para comprar un terreno ahora el esta construyendo y le falta el techo de su vivienda. El vive en la casa de su mama mientra termina la construcción, pero ya la familia va creciendo y necesita su espacio y privacidad como pareja.
Leopoldo tiene tres hijos a quienes piensa dejarles un buen patrimonio y buen hogar para cuando ellos crezcan es por ello que pide un prestímano para comprar material y pagar mano para terminar la construcción.
La señora y el trabajan en maquiladora para el sostén de ellos mismos con estos ingresos ellos pagarían el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Leopoldo Chavarría D. is a person who is always looking out for his family's well-being. Over the years he was raising money to buy land, and he is now building a home on it but it's missing a roof. He is living in his mother's home while the construction is being completed, but his family continues to grow and he needs space and privacy with his wife. Leopoldo has three children whom has wants to leave with a good patrimony and a good home when they grow up, and it's for this reason he is requesting a loan to purchase material and pay for the construction to be completed. He and his wife work at a factory to provide for themselves, and with this income they will repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a roof on his home

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos C. C., tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio las enramadas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos, estudiante actualmente, los planes hacia su futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 27 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la afectación volcánica, el inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder aplicar a la cosecha para poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos pues es su séptimo ciclo el cual ha podido dar buen seguimiento a sus siembra.
texts.en:
Santos C. C. is 50 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Along with his wife, who also works, they cover household expenses and provide for their two children, who are currently in school. Their plans for the future is to improve their quality of life. For the past 27 years Santos has made a living in agriculture. His biggest problem has been a lack of funding and volcanic activity. He started his work on his own and plans to improve his crops in the future. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to buy fertilizers and planting supplies to be able to sell his crops at better prices at the market. He is thankful for Kiva and the loan institution for its support, since this is his seventh credit cycle and he has been able to well-monitor his plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and planting supplies

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Force and Power village bank. She is a single mother with two sons who are 21 and 18 years-old. They both work and go to school. Hilda is from Puno and came to Lima to study nursing but was not able to finish because she became pregnant. 

In order to support herself, she sold candy in the streets for the next eight years. Eventually she had to stop because street vendors were prohibited where she was selling and the police would take away the products of these vendors. Around the same time she became pregnant again and decided to start selling her goods out of her house.  Business went well and Hilda decided to expand and start selling meals at her house with her daughter’s help. 

Since joining FINCA she has gained self-confidence and has improved her economic situation. Hilda needs a loan of 800 soles to buy more rice, sugar, and noodles for the meals she sells at home. Her dream is to grow her business and continue her personal growth.

loans.use: buy more rice, sugar, and noodles for the meals she sells at home

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene 38 años y viene luchando por tener una vida mejor. Actualmente vive solo, pues es soltero. Su dedicación principal son los cultivos de café, plátanos y frutos cítricos (naranjas y mandarinas), con los cuales se siente muy feliz. Nos comenta que la siembra de café es dificultosa porque el abonado debe ser constante y eso requiere de mucha inversión, además que se cosecha cada año. Pero en el caso de los plátanos, aunque también necesitan de abono, su cosecha es semanal o cada quincena, donde los compradores van hasta su chacra y le compran por racimos dependiendo del tamaño de los plátanos. Con respecto a las naranjas, las vende por ciento. Cirilo prefiere vender sus frutos desde su chacra, en vez de transportarlos y comercializarlos él mismo, pues aun así logra buenas ganancias. A él lo acaban de invitar a integrarse a un banco comunal, por lo que se siente muy agradecido. Asimismo, hace compromisos de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero del crédito que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos cafetaleros.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 38 years old and fighting for a better life. He currently lives alone, as he is single. His main activity is growing coffee, bananas, and citrus fruits (oranges and tangerines), and this makes him happy. He told us that planting coffee is difficult because it requires fertilizer constantly, which requires a lot of investment considering it is only harvested once a year. Although the bananas also require fertilizer, they can be harvested every 1 to 2 weeks. Buyers come to Cirilo's farm to buy the bananas by the bunch, depending on the size of the fruit. He sells the oranges by the hundred. Cirilo prefers selling the fruit at his farm, instead of transporting and selling it in a market, because he makes better profit that way. He has recently been invited to join a community bank, and feels very grateful. That is why he has committed to making all his repayments on time. He plans to use the loan money he is requesting to invest in chemical fertilizers for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 36 años, vive en casa de sus padres y aun no tiene planes de casarse, ni de tener hijos. Desde niño se ha dedicado a la siembra de plátanos, café y piña, pero lo que más le gusta es el café, porque en las épocas de cosecha puede acumular rápidamente dinero. Por tal motivo, después de la recolección se apresura en lavar y secar los granos, posteriormente alquila un carro para transportar el café hasta la empresa que le cotiza a un precio considerable, el cual le permite cubrir su inversión y obtener buenas ganancias. Mientras que los plátanos los vende en su misma chacra cada quince días; esa es la rutina laboral de Félix, además le gusta mucho su actividad, es por ello que lo realiza con mucha dedicación. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser un cliente muy puntal al pagar cada una de sus cuotas y se siente muy cómodo con todos sus compañeros de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos cafetaleros.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Juan Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Juan Andrés C. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene un negocio de renta de sonido para eventos sociales y fotografía, le está haciendo falta un equipo más moderno y de mejor calidad, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio ya que no quiere descapitalizarse. 
Ya que tiene varios eventos que le están solicitando este tipo de sonido. 
Don Juan planea pagar esté crédito con los ingresos que generara el negocio con su nuevo equipo.
texts.en:
Juan Andrés C. has already taken out a loan from FVP, which he repaid on time. He is again requesting a loan for his business of sound equipment rental for social events and photography. He needs better quality equipment that is more modern, but doesn't have the money to invest and does not want to drain his business' capital reserve. Many of the events he is already scheduled for require this type of sound equipment. Juan plans to repay this loan with the income he generates with the new equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer sound equipment.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente tiene 55 años, es padre de 4 hijos, quienes ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. Actualmente él vive solo en su casa propia en compañía de sus mascotas. Su actividad principal es la siembra y cultivo de plantas cafetaleras y plátanos, todos los días se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para trabajar tranquilamente sin sofocarse con el sol. En el caso de los plátanos, cada quince días cosecha y se dirige al cercado (lugar donde se realizan las ferias de la ciudad), donde se ubican todos los comerciantes y es muy concurrido, por lo que termina de vender rápidamente. En el caso del café, en las temporadas de cosecha trata de acumular la mayor cantidad de producto y espera a los compradores que ya lo conocen y van a buscarlo, donde romana en mano (instrumento que sirve para pesar), selecciona de 12 en 12 kilos rápidamente acumulando el saco de 60, obteniendo un buen precio sin tener que salir a la ciudad, por ello Vicente se siente muy complacido con su trabajo. El es nuevo en MFP y por ello se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas y a participar en todas las actividades de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Vicente is 55 years old and the father of 4 adult children who have their own families. He currently lives alone in the company of his pets. Vicente grows coffee and bananas. Every day he wakes up at 5am and quietly goes about working without suffocating in the sun.

He harvests bananas every two weeks and sells them at different fairs held throughout the city. He is popular among the other traders, so he ends up selling his products fairly quickly.

During the coffee harvest season, it is best to accumulate as much product as possible and wait for the buyers who already know what they want. Using the “romana en mano” (an instrument used for weighing) he rapidly measures out 12 kilos of coffee beans at a time until he has enough to fill a 60 kilo sack. He usually receives a good price without having to leave the city, so Vicente is very pleased with his efforts.

Vicente is a new client of MFP and therefore has agreed to make his payments on time and participate in all Communal Bank activities. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Isabel Z. tiene ya más de doce años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso ya que es viuda y vive sola.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda, pero ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder invertir en surtir. 
Es por eso solicita un préstamo y así poder comprar la mercancía que le están pidiendo, y tener más ingresos, con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Verónica Isabel Z. has more than twelve years experience selling groceries. She is a widow who lives by herself, so this business is her only means of support.

At the moment, she is lacking the variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting. She does not have the necessary capital to invest in additional inventory. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase the requested goods and earn more income. The repayments for this loan will come from the revenue she expects to generate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Candelaria Monserrat

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Monserrat D. va ha ser madre soltera ya que pronto tendrá a su hijo.
Solicita un préstamo para pagar el enganche de una vivienda por medio de Infonavit, ya que actual mente está viviendo con sus papas, ella desea tener ya un patrimonio seguro para su hijo. 
Canceraría trabaja como cajera en un centro comercia, esté es el ingreso que tiene para ella y su hijo y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
