loans.use: Diferencia para el enganche de una vivienda por medio de Infonavit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of a gate in front of her house

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián tiene 52 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 28 años tiene un pequeño establecimiento en el Mercado Moshoqueque, una zona en donde se efectúa el comercio mayorista de diversos productos; allí vende cereales, en su mayoría procesados por él, a establecimientos y bodegas de la ciudad.

Durante todo este tiempo el ha venido trabajando con esmero en su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que de ello depende su sustento, el desea seguir sosteniéndolos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Por este motivo está solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles a nuestra empresa para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más material para procesar cereales y venderlos a sus clientes.

Su mas grande anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos estudios superiores para sí asegurarles un mejor futuro.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Julián is 52 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the city of Chiclayo. For the past 28 years, he has managed a small establishment in the Moshoqueque Market where various products are sold wholesale. His business processes and sells cereals to stores and vendors throughout the city.

During this time, Julián has been working hard at his business to support his family because their livelihood depends on it. He hopes to continue providing for them so that they can have a better quality of life.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from our Institution to expand his business. He plans to purchase more materials for processing cereals that he can sell to his customers. His greatest desire is to offer his children the opportunity to pursue higher education so that they can have a better future.

This is the second time Julián has worked with us. He has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his payments, which makes him an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for processing cereals

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 48 años, es un hombre que siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro, es separado hace 20 años y vive solo en su casa propia. Él tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia en la ciudad de Tarma, la cual se ubica a 5 horas en auto desde su localidad. Él considera su trabajo muy placentero, pues desde niño le ha gustado dedicarse al labrado y cuidado de las plantas y conoce cómo y cuándo cuidar de ellas para que le generen muy buenos ingresos. Es por ello que se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para quitar todas las malezas y arbustos de sus plantaciones. Su siembra preferida es el café, aunque se demora tres años para cosechar, igual le agrada ese cultivo, ya que llegada la época de cosecha la comercialización le genera muy buenas ganancias. Con el dinero acumulado invierte en sus siguientes siembras y también envía dinero a su hijo para sus gastos estudiantiles, pues su anhelo es que se convierta en un buen profesional. Estaban está muy agradecido con el presidente de su banco comunal, pues fue él quien lo invitó a integrarse al grupo. Por su parte, él se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas para no defraudar al resto de sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Esteban is always seen with a smile on his face. He is 48 years old, lives alone in his own home, and has been separated for the past 20 years. He has a 17 year old son who is studying in the city of Tarma, which is 5 hours away by car from his home. Esteban enjoys his work. As a young man, he liked to engage in hard labor and taking care of plants because he knew these activities could bring in a good income. For this reason, he gets up early in the morning to remove all the weeds and shrubs around his plantation. He enjoys planting coffee the most even though it takes three years for the crop to mature. Estaban also likes the harvest season when he can bring his goods to market and earn a good profit. With the savings he accumulates, he invests in the crops for the following season and also sends some spending money to his son for school, since he wants him to become a professional.

Esteban is very grateful to the president of his Communal Bank for inviting him to be part of their group. He has agreed to make all his payments on time so that he does not disappoint the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells snails and other food items. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more snails and other food items to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs drinks and provisions. She is from Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es: Meliton tiene 30 años, es un joven muy maduro y de buen carácter, vive en la casa de su madre, con sus 4 medio hermanos (hermanastros). De muy pequeño su padre falleció, entonces heredó sus chacras de plátanos y café, pero él no los tomó en cuenta y se fue a Lima (capital del Perú) con aras de triunfar, pero no le fue muy bien. Entonces pensó en volver y dedicarse a sus chacras, lo cual hace ahora diariamente; trabaja y vela por sus cultivos, con sueños de realizar buenas cosechas. En el transcurso de 2 años estas plantas iban de maravilla, mostrando su copiosidad y vitalidad, pero apareció la plaga de mosquitos, lo que tiene a Meliton muy preocupado. Es por ello que quiere erradicarla a tiempo para realizar una buena cosecha y de ahí enviarlos directamente a la colectora y de ese modo acumular dinero para que incrementar sus plantaciones de café. Ahora que tiene por primera vez la oportunidad de este crédito, no piensa defraudar la confianza puesta en él, ni tampoco ante el resto de sus compañeros, ya que tuvo buenos comentarios del trabajo en un banco comunal. Por ello, el dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de pesticidas para erradicar los mosquitos de sus plantas de cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Meliton is 30 years old and very mature for a good-natured young man of his age. He lives at home with his mother and 4 half brothers. His father died when he was very young and inherited his banana and coffee farms. From the outset, he did not do anything with the land he inherited and traveled to the capital of Lima in search of success but did not fare very well. He reconsidered going back to the farm, which is where he now makes his living every day. For the past two years his crops have been great, producing abundant yields and indicating all signs of vitality. Then a plague of mosquitoes appeared, which left Meliton worried. He wants to eradicate them in time for the harvest so that he can submit his output to the coffee traders to earn money he needs to expand his coffee operation.

Meliton is receiving his first loan. He hopes not to disappoint the other members of the Communal Bank and others who have placed their confidence in him and have given good comments about his work. He will use the money he requested to purchase pesticides to eradicate the mosquitoes that have taken up residence among his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl es un joven de 28 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada, ya que es huérfano de padre y madre, pero tiene una hermana que ocasionalmente lo visita. Años atrás se dedicaba a diversos trabajos como operario en la ciudad de Santa Ana, en ese tiempo logró ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar una parcela. Cumplido ese objetivo, ahora se ha propuesto sembrar plátanos, porque considera que es un fruto muy rentable, ya que se cosecha cada quince días y a veces semanalmente. Raúl acaba de mudarse a esta comunidad, llamada “Sanchirio”, donde recién está haciendo amistades. Y por el momento está haciendo limpieza de su nueva chacra, quitando los arbustos y malezas para después fumigar y en menos de 3 meses cree que ya recolectará sus primeros plátanos. Inicialmente piensa negociarlos a los compradores que van a esa zona, pero con el pasar de los años piensa incrementar sus chacras  con la finalidad de convertirse en mayorista. Asimismo lo acaban de nombrar presidente de su banco comunal, el cual se acaba de formar, por lo que es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello hace compromisos de no defraudar tal confianza. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de insecticidas y 6 sacos de fertilizantes químicos para sus plantaciones de plátano.
texts.en:
Raúl is 28 years old and lives alone in a rented house. His parents are deceased, but he has a sister who occasionally visits him. Years ago, he worked as a laborer at various jobs in the city of Santa Ana. He managed to save enough money to buy a plot of land. He decided to grow bananas, which has proven to be very profitable. He harvested bananas every two weeks, and sometimes weekly.

Raúl recently moved to the community called “Sanchirio” and is already making new friends. At the moment, he spends most of his time on his new property cleaning – removing bushes and weeds, and also spraying for pests. He expects his first harvest of bananas to be ready in less than 3 months. Initially, he thought it would be best to negotiate with buyers who pass through the area. He now plans to increase his output with the intention of becoming a direct wholesaler.

Raúl is a member of a Communal Bank that recently formed, and he has just been appointed to be the chairman for the group. This will be his first loan with MFP and he is committed not to betray his group’s trust. He will use the money he requested to buy insecticides and 6 sacks of chemical fertilizer for his banana crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & insecticides

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 53 years old and married with six children. She sells snails. She has been in business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more snails to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase snails to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a timber converter. She buys timber and takes it to the saw mill for conversion. She is 53 years old and married with six children. She hopes for a loan amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more timber. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase timber to take to the saw mill for conversion

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs and other clothes. She hopes for the loan amount of 80000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and other second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rsoe is 62 years old and married with 3 children. She sells jewelries and sarongs. Rose lives in Benin City and has been in business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more jewelries and sarongs. She thanks all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and jewelries to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells sarongs and is also a tailor. She is 52 years old and a widow with seven children. She has been in business for the past ten years. She is requesting a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs  to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells clothes, bags and shoes. She is 42 years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of 80000 NGN to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and bags to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She has a bore hole for commercial purpose and also rent out cooking utensils for ceremonies. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase a generator for power supply. This will alternate for electricity for the pumping machine. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Ise

texts.en: Ise sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She has been in the business for long. Ise lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline sells drinks, breads and other items. She is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 60000 NGN to purchase more drinks and also bush meat to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and also bush meat to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 48 years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Dorothy sells drinks and food items. She hopes for a loan amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more drinks and food items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food items to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Loveth sells provisions and drinks. She is 55 years old and married with seven children. Loveth lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kapitalina

texts.en:
Kapitalina is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She started her small venture 15 years ago, in the time of perestroika. Those times were very unstable, especially for business startups. However, Kapitalina took a risk and succeeded. Presently, she has a stable business selling knitted clothing in one of the biggest markets in her home town. She has 50,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month.

Kapitalina is requesting a loan of 11,300 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for fall season. She has loyal clientele and expects to have her customers come back shopping for new clothing this fall. Kapitalina is very outgoing and friendly which makes it a pleasure to deal with her for both her clients and fellow market vendors.

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise for resale

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Uaminifu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 134,4 years.

Zuhura started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zuhura`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zuhura hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 48 years old woman,she is single and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 30,28,26,21,15,11 years.

Elizabeth started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 4 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 280,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Elizabeth hopes to save more money,pay school fess,get more food for family and expand her business.

This is Husna`s first Loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more sugar,rice cooking oil etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Husna hopes to save more,get more food for family,pay school fees money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,wheat,salts for food

loans.name: Mafisa Group

loans.name: Jalagat

texts.en:
Jalagat R. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Jalagat is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Jalagat owns and operates a business selling raw food products, such as fish and hotdogs, in the local community. Jalagat has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jalagat joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jalagat is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jalagat from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María Lilian R. D. P. resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. María vive con su hija y su nieta, mientras que su hija sale a trabajar fuera D. casa la abuelita María cuida D. su nieta Michell D. 2 años D. edad. María también trabaja desD. su casa ya que tiene montada una tienda con productos D. consumo para el hogar, el anhelo D. María es poder surtir su negocio con más variedad D. marcas y productos pero esto solo sera posible con la ayuda D. su crédito, que le permitirá a María surtir su negocio y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
María Lilian R. D. P. lives in the town of Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She lives with her daughter and granddaughter.

When her daughter leaves for work, Grandma María takes care of her 2 year old granddaughter Michell. She also operates a store from home in which she sells basic consumer products. She wants to restock her store with a greater variety of products of different brands. This can only be maD. possible with the help of a loan. We hope that you will allow María the opportunity to fill her business so that she can improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her inventory

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a member of the Udugu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 1 year.she also cares for 1 other dependent.

Khadija started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Khadija`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the  loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Khadija hopes to save money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi J. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango del departamento D. San Salvador. Ana se encuentra casada y vive con su esposo e hijo D. 22 años D. edad quien se encuentra trabajando como mecánico en un taller automotriz. Ana ha montado un escenario D. venta en su casa donD. muestra las diferentes blusas y zapatos que venD., Ana solicita este crédito ya que su sueño es poder tener un espacio más organizado donD. sus clientes puedan ver y probarse su ropa cómodamente es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Daysi J. D. R. lives in the town of Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She is married and lives with her husband and 22 year old son, who is a mechanic at an auto repair shop. Ana sells different types of blouses and shoes from her home. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Her plan is to have a more organized space where customers can see and try on clothes in a comfortable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment into her clothing business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa D. D. H. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa tiene 29 años D. edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja para el servicio militar y también con sus hijos  Wilber D. 8 años edad y Stefany D. 3 años D. edad. Rosa se dedica  a su negocio desD. su casa, venD. variedad D. productos como ropa y  perfumes, Rosa solicita un crédito ya que desea aumentar su inventario en sus productos,  lo que ayudara a mantener un equilibrio con mercedaria que tiene 50% por cobrar y desequilibra su liquidez económica.
texts.en:
Rosa D. D. H. lives in the district of La Libertad. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, Wilber (age 8) and Stefany (age 3). Her husband works for the military service. Rosa operates a business from home, selling a variety of products such as clothing and perfumes. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of products. This will help her maintain a balance of 50% merchandise on hand that her customers have already paid for with the other half being items that her customers requested on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix G. S. reside en Sata Tecla municipio del departamento de  La Libertad. Félix tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su madre y su hermano, Félix posee un negocio en su casa es una tienda de consumo diario. Félix está solicitando un crédito para mejoras de su vivienda, como la colocación de puertas, instalación  de balcones para las ventanas exteriores, con este crédito Félix podrá brindarle seguridad a su familia y  cambios significativos en su hogar, que por razones económicas siempre los estaba dejando de realizar.
texts.en:
Félix G. S. lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the district of La Libertad. He is 51 years old and lives with his mother and brother. Félix operates a business out of his home selling daily consumer products.

He is requesting a home improvement loan in order to install doors and balconies to the exterior windows. These modifications will provide security for his family. He has been delaying these improvements because of a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of doors & balconies

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth T. G. vive en Zaragoza ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad. Sandra tiene 23 años de edad y se encuentra casada. A pesar de esta muy joven Sandra ha logrado montar su propio negocio, tras la experiencia obtenida años atrás Sandra se decidió que estaba lista para emprender su negocio con una Sala de Belleza;  y es así como ahora tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia y sus clientes son muy frecuentes. Sandra genera empleo a una persona más, que es cosmetóloga y ayuda a atender a los clientes, hoy Sandra solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con productos de belleza que le ayudan a generar mayores ganancias, ya que sus clientes siempre preguntan y quieren comprar productos para el cuidado del cabello después de ser atendidos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth T. G. lives in Zaragoza, which is located in the district of La Libertad. She is 23 years old and married. Despite being very young, Sandra already has managed to start her own business. After a few years of gaining work experience, Sandra decided she was ready to open a beauty salon. Her business is located in an affluent area and she already has clients who visit her frequently. Sandra employs one other person, a cosmetologist who helps attend to her clients.

Sandra is requesting a loan to restock her business with beauty products, which will help generate more revenue. Her clients are always asking for hair care products they can use after they have received their treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell at her salon

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the village of Buyog, Banlag, Valencia City. She is 54 years old. Virginia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been in business for over five years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Wildor David

texts.es:
El señor Wildor David A. T. tiene 27 años y al ser el hermano menor de 4 hermanos es el único que aun vive con sus padres. Los cuales se dedican a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona. No tiene hijos pues asegura que primero quiere hacerse de casa y un buen trabaja para no hacer sufrir de problemas de dinero y no hacerle faltar nada a su esposa e hijos. El señor Wildor vive en la zona Oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde tiene 1 automóvil que usa como taxi para ganar dinero y por las noches estudia Mecánica Automotriz en un instituto de enseñanza superior.


El préstamo será destinado para pagar el saldo que le falta por la compra del vehículo que tiene. El señor Wildor espera poder sacar otro préstamo para instalar en su movilidad un equipo de gas y así gastar menos en combustible y mejorar sus ingresos netos.
texts.en:
Mr. Wildor David A. T. is 27 years old, and as he is the youngest brother of four siblings, he is the only one who still lives with his parents. They sell food in a market in the area. He doesn’t have children as, first, he wants to get himself a house and a good job in order to not suffer from money problems and not deprive his wife and children of anything. Mr. Wildor lives in the Western area of the city of Cochamamba, where he has one car which is used as a taxi in order to earn money, and in the night, he studies auto mechanics in an institute of higher education. The loan will be used to pay the balance that he owes for the purchase of the vehicle that he has. Mr. Wildor hopes to be able to take out another loan in order to install in his vehicle gas equipment and as such spend less on fuel and improve his net income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for vehicle purchase

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 37-year-old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Mangal M., and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 10 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop seven years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items, including dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots and much more. The income from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting their third loan of NPR30,000.00 from Kiva to buy more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Karuna

texts.en:
Karuna C. is a 44-year-old lady lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Rakesh C., is engaged in his own small business. She has one son and one daughter. Her son and daughter are now studying at the university.

Mrs. Karuna C. opened her small restaurant a few years ago. In her restaurant, she sells newari foods. Newari food is very popular in Lalitpur district because a majority of the people in this region are newar and newari food is also very delicious to eat. She also serves tea and coffee to the customers.

To meet the increasing demand, she is requesting Rs 25,000.00 to buy various food materials for her shop. She utilizes her income for household expenses.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Saru

texts.en:
Mrs. Saru M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. 

Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Narayan M., is a laborer in house construction work. She has one son and one daughter. Her older child is studying in grade 7 and small child is just a year old.

Mrs. M. is engaged in agricultural work. She owns her own land and she prefers to grow green vegetables on her land. She especially likes to grow seasonal vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening. She uses her earnings for household expenses.

Now she is requesting Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for her agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita M. is a married woman who lives in Thecho with her husband and one son. Both her husband, Mr. Bikram M., and Ramita are engaged in making wax statues. They have six years of experience in this work . They learned this work from their suppliers. They sell their statues in Patan. The Patan area is a well-known place for idol-making work in Nepal. 

In order to sustain their business, they have to invest continuously in their business. So Mrs. M. is requesting a second loan of Rs 25,000 from Kiva to buy various types of raw material like wax and equipment for their work.

They have a 5-year-old son who is studying in boarding school. Mrs. M. and her husband are planning to save their income for their son’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bindu S. lives in Chapagaun.  Chapagaun is located in Lalitpur district. Most people in this region are newars and the main occupation of the people in this region is agricultural.

Mrs. S. lives in a single family with her husband and one son.  All the members of her family are engaged in agricultural work. They work on their own land. Mostly they grow green vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily.

Now Mrs. Bindu S. is requesting a Rs 10,000.00 loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dev Maiya

texts.en:
Dev Maiya D. lives in Chappagaun Village. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Mr. Ramhari D. and he is a farmer. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming. 

Mrs. D. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of traditional sandals, which are made of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in kitchens. These types of sandals are also used in wedding ceremonies. She has three years of experience in this job. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season. 

She supplies her products in Asan Market. Asan is one of the very busy bazaars of Kathmandu. Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 10,000.00 loan to buy raw material for her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Aapasara

texts.en:
Aapasara T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work.
Mrs. T. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is engaged in agricultural work.  She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 12 and daughter is studying in grade 8.
Mrs. T. is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already own one cow and selling cow’s milk door to door in the local market. Due to the increasing demand of the milk Mrs. T. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loan to buys another young cow to meet the increasing demand of cow’s milk.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in single family with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Rajkumar T., is a farmer. She has two sons and a daughter. Both her sons and daughter are now studying.

Mrs. T. is engaged in selling cow’s milk. Now she already owns one cow and sells the cow’s milk in her neighborhood. In that region, the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly. So to meet the demand of the customers, she needs another young milk-giving cow. So she is requesting Rs 20,000.00 to buy a young milk cow.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
Ram Kumari S. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. Her older son is studying in grade 12 and her two younger son is studying in grade 8 and 6 respectively.

Mrs. S. is a cosmetic shopkeeper in the town of Bholdhoka. She also sells different varieties of sandals in her shop. She used her second Kiva loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods. Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 NPR to further expand her business to earn more. Her aim is to upgrade the living standard of her family and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada C. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Diosdada is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdada owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty snack food products in the local community. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Diosdada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada is requesting a loan of 5,000 ,which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan Diosdada has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Mrs. Lila S., 30 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint family household with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband, sister-in-law, brother-in-law and a daughter. The economic condition of her family is very weak. They are unable to even fulfill the basic needs of the family and can't provide a better education for her daughter.

Her husband, Suresh S., is a driver for a private office and her daughter is studying in grade 6.

Mrs. S. opened her vegetable shop two years ago to improve the living standards of her family. She also sells grocery goods in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 20,000.00 to buy green vegetables and grocery goods for her shop.

Her family's economic condition is very poor, so Mrs Lila would like to grow her business continually and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Chandika

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandika S. lives in Bholdhoka, lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two son. Her husband Mr. Shyam S. is  a driver. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and younger son is studying in grade 3.
Mrs. Chandika opens her shoe shop eight years ago. In her shop she sells different types of shoes for all group and gender. She opens her shoe shop to uplift the economic condition of her family.
She use her income in household expenses.
Now she is requesting for Rs 15000.00 loan to buys different types of shoes to meet the increasing demand of shoes in that area.

loans.use: To buys shoes for her shop

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita Ranjitkar, a resident of Tangal, lives in a single family household with her husband and two sons. Her older son works in a finance office and her younger son is studying in grade 12.

Together, Mrs. Ranjitkar and her husband, Mr. Sankhaman Ranjitkar, opened their small restaurant seven years ago to strengthen the economic condition of their family. They sell different varieties of food items in their shop. Specifically, she prepares Newari foods. The majority of the people living in the Lalitpur district are Newars, so Newari food is very famous and tasty. The demand for Newari food is increasing day by day. They also serve tea and coffee. Her restaurant is small but very popular in her locality.

Now, Mrs. Ranjitkar is requesting her second loan of Rs 20,000.00 from Kiva to buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her shop

loans.name: Ganesh Maiya

texts.en:
Ganesh Maiya R. opened her gift shop three years ago in the town of Tangal to improve the living standards of her family. She sells various types of gifts and decorative items in her shop. 

In Nepal, the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So, to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. Ganesh Maiya R. is requesting a Rs 30,000.00 loan to buy various types of gift items for her shop.

Ganesh Maiya R. lives in a nuclear family with her two children. Her husband, Mr. Santa Krishna R., died a few years ago. Now she has sole responsibility for her two children. Her daughter works in a local office and her son left his education and has no work.

loans.use: to buy gift items for her shop

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Letecia is separated from her spouse and has two young children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Para

texts.en:
Para K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Koteshwor. Her husband's name is Lalit K. and he works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in secondary school.

Para opened her bag shop four years ago to help her husband in fulfilling the household expenses. She sells different types of bags, such as school and ladies bags, in her shop. She buys these bags from the wholesale market. Now she is requesting a Rs 25,000.00 loan to expand her shop. She wants to buy different varieties of bags.

Para wants to use her income for her children’s education and she also wants to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi C. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family household with four members: herself, her husband  and two sons.

Her husband, Mr. Bishnu C., is a driver. Her older son studies at the university and younger son is studying in grade 12.

Mrs. Laxmi C. started selling cows' milk three months ago. She already owns a cow. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy another young cow to sell milk, because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal, people love to drink cows' milk so the demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: to buy one more cow

loans.name: Ganu

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu C. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhaishipati. She started her grocery store two years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, etc. in her shop.

Due to the lack of money she cannot expand her business and attract more customers. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 to expand her business.

Mrs. C. lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Raghunath, works is an electrician. They have one son and one daughter and both children are now studying.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

Corazon has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Lide Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lide de 47 años de edad, casada procreo  dos hijos los dos estudiantes, reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la capital de Managua, su esposo se desempeña como carpintero y se esfuerza para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vende cosméticos, ropa y zapatos desde hace ocho años, el cual inicio con dinero propio y con prestamos que Afodenic presto. Con esta solicitud e préstamo comprara cosméticos, perfumenes y ropa para incrementar las ventas y la captación de clientes nuevos. Espera lograr ganancias y poder sastifacer las necesidades de su casa, a si como poder terminar de construir su casa, ya tiene una parte construida pero va poco a poco ya que todo esta caro pero afuturo espera lograr terminarla y cosar de una casa digna. tambien  apoyar a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Comprar cosmeticos, perfumenes y ropa

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
Alina tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive con su esposo en el centro poblado Saltur, que pertenece al distrito D. Zaña, ubicado a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace un año tiene una pequeña bodega – tienda que administra junto a su esposo, ambos le dedican todo el tiempo que tienen disponible para ayudarse y salir adelante, su esposo es pensionista y con el dinero D. su pensión compraron sus primeros productos; poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo y ahora ellos desean ampliarlo con la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Por este motivo ella está solcitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio para solventar sus gastos y tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto a sus esposo y, con el paso del tiempo, dejárselo a uno D. sus hijos.

Alina es muy conocida por los vecinos D. su comunidad, los cuales la quieren y estiman mucho ya que es una mujer responsable y muy activa.
texts.en:
Alina is 64 years old and has 7 children. She lives with her husband in the center of the village of Saltur in the district of Zana, located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a small shop for a year that she manages with her husband. Both of them devote all the time that they have to help themselves to get ahead. Her husband is retired and they bought their first products with his pension. Little by little the business grew and now they would like to expand it with the purchase of staples (rice, sugar, oil) and groceries to offer to their customers.

For this reason she is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian Nuevo Soles, U$375) from our institution. She wants to grow the business in order to meet their living expenses and have a better quality of life, and eventually to leave the business to one of their sons.

Alina is very well known by the neighbors in the community, who like and respect her as an active, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staples to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja Andrés de 41 años, y sus hijos Carlos de 17 y Brigitte de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, actividad que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que sus hijos están estudiando y por ende tienen más gastos. Lidia comienza su jornada diaria a las 7 de la mañana, tiempo en el cual realiza las tareas domésticas y posteriormente sale a ofrecer su mercadería a sus vecinas, familiares y amigas, las cuales siempre están en espera de alguna novedad. A Lidia le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede conversar, visitar a sus amigas y conocer nueva personas, lo malo es que al final del día termina agotada y otras veces es que algunas clientas no le pagan puntualmente, pero ahora tiene más cuidado con eso y ha mejorado mucho en sus ventas. Este es el tercer préstamo de Lidia con MFP y ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo Jorge de 58 años, el cual es chofer, y con sus hijos Savela de 25, Rocío de 22 y Jorge Luis de 21. Desde hace casi 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tiempo en el cual ha podido aprender del negocio y “agarrarle el truco” como ella lo dice. Ahora, con la experiencia ganada ha logrado obtener buenos ingresos, los cuales le son de mucha ayuda, ya que el sueldo de chofer de su esposo no alcanza para todos los gastos de la familia. Además a Noemí siempre le gustó ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero para poder disponer ella misma. Es por eso que está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite tener disponibilidad de tiempo, aprovechando de realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar y el resto del tiempo en ofrecer sus productos de belleza a sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Pues además de venderles, realiza visitas muy amenas, ya que también aconseja sobre los colores, tonos y productos que más le favorecen a sus clientas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta con su grupo, ya que todas son buenas amigas y cumplen con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprar más productos para tener en stock y así poco a poco convertir su negocio en algo más grande y rentable.
texts.en:
Noemi is 46 years old and lives with her husband, Jorge who is 58 and a chauffeur, and with their sons, Savela who is 25, Rocio who is 22, and Jorge Luis who is 21. For almost 2 years she has sold beauty products. During that time she has been able to learn the business and ‘get the trick of it’ as she says. Now, with the experience gained, she has been earning a good income, which is a big help because the salary of a chauffeur is not enough for all the family expenses. Additionally, Noemi has always liked to be independent and earn her own money to provide for herself. That is why she is very happy with a job that permits her to have time available to do her household chores at home and the rest of the time to offer her beauty products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She enjoys the visits as well as selling her products because she also gives advice about colors, tones and products that favor her customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy with her group. They are all very good friends and meet all payments. With the money she has asked to buy more products to have in stock to slowly turn her business into something larger and more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Alfonso de 39, quien es comerciante, y con sus hijos Miriam de 17 y Yordi de 9 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual puso a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Debido a que su esposo también es comerciante, ahora entre los dos pueden generar muchos más ingresos para el bien de su familia. A Rosmery le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que lo realiza desde su casa y puede distribuir su tiempo entre las labores del hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y la atención a su negocio. Por otro lado, su tienda le resulta muy rentable, ya que abre desde tempranas horas y cierra ya entrada la noche, por eso ella quiere seguir mejorando su negocio expandiendo su espacio y abasteciéndolo con más productos para captar más clientela. Lamentablemente algunas veces el permanecer durante todo el día le resulta muy cansado, pero felizmente sus hijos la ayudan, ocasionalmente, con la atención y así ella pueda salir a adquirir más productos para aumentar su mercadería. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosmery en su banco comunal con MFP, ella y sus compañeras son muy  puntuales en los pagos. Pero no fue siempre así, ya que al inicio tuvieron compañeras que fallaron en algunos pagos, sin embargo ahora sólo quedaron las más responsables. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar golosinas para abarcar el segmento infantil, que lo había dejado un poco olvidado y así tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Solinda

texts.es: Solinda tiene 42 años, vive con sus hijos: Eduardo de 20, Miguel de 19 y Fiorela de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la administración de su negocio, ella cuenta con un auto para el que contrata un chofer que realiza el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y cada día rinde las ganancias con Solinda. Ella nos cuenta que anteriormente tenía una tienda de productos comestibles, pero a causa de que uno de sus hijos iba a postular a la marina vendió todo para su preparación; posteriormente, él, con las ganancias de su trabajo ayudó a su madre a comprar el auto. Solinda se siente feliz con su trabajo, ya que le resulta rentable, además puede ofrecerle trabajo a otra persona y brindarles a sus hijos menores un mejor porvenir. Para el futuro quiere adquirir otro carro para que lo maneje uno de sus hijos, quien también está deseoso de ponerse a trabajar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, anteriormente trabajó con bancos comunales, pero le resulta más cómodo sacar un préstamo individual, ya que no dispone de mucho tiempo libre. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en pago de revisión técnica de su vehiculo, además quiere convertirlo a uso de gas y darle una capa de pintura.
texts.en:
Solinda is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her children: Eduardo who is 20, Miguel who is 19, and Fiorela who is 12. For 2 years she has managed her own business. She owns a car and hires a driver to provide transportation services to passengers and which every day yields profits. She tells us that earlier she had a grocery store, but because one of her sons was thinking about joining the navy, she sold the store to pay for all of his preparations. Afterwards, he, with his earnings, helped his mother to buy the car. Solinda feels happy with her job, that is already profitable and can also provide work to another person and offers his small children a better future. In the future, she wants to acquire another car for one of her sons to drive, who are also eager to work. This is her fourth loan with MFP. Earlier she worked with communal banks, but it turns out that she is more comfortable to take out an individual loan because she does not have much free time. The money she is asking for will be invested in mechanical repairs for the car as well as a new coat of paint and will also be used for gas.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: auto maintenance

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dalia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Dalia Chavarría esta preocupada por la educación de sus dos hijas, una de ellas va a entrar a preescolar y la quiere meter a una escuela particular; donde le enseñen el Ingles ya que como vive en ciudad Fronteriza es muy esencial que los niños desde pequeños aprendan otro idioma.
Dalia quiere un préstamo para comprar los útiles de su hija, uniformes, ropa, zapatos, mochila y pagar la colegiatura. El esposo de Dalia es un señor responsable que le ayuda con los gastos el trabaja en una vidriera desde hace 7 años para que a su familia no le falte nada, también Dalia trabaja en una Agencia Aduanal para el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalia C. is concerned about the education of her two daughters. One of them is going to enter preschool and she wants to put her in a particular school where she will be taught English. Because she lives in a Mexican border town it is essential that the children learn another language from a young age.

Dalia wants a loan to buy school supplies for her daughter: uniforms, clothes, shoes, and knapsack and to pay the school fees. Her husband is a responsible man who helps with the expenses. He has worked in a glass shop for 7 years so that his family lacks nothing. Dalia also works in the Customs Agency to support her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar utiles de su hija

loans.name: Julio Ulises

texts.es: Don Julio S. tiene la edad de 47 años, es un hombre que desde joven a trabajado en el campo, como agricultor, otras veces de albañil para ganarse el pan de cada día para su familia, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, por falta de trabajo tuvo que emigrar a Costa Rica país vecino para sobresalir adelante  trabajo seis años el cual logro recorrer dinero y compro tierras para sembrar. En este momento el esta trabajando en la alcaldía el villa el Carmen como recolector de basura pero también trabaja sus tierras, con esta solicitud en Afodenic es para terminar de comprar mas tierras para lograr tener cinco manzanas las cuales empezara a sembrar para lograr la independencia y dedicarse a su propio negocio. Se siente sastifecho por lograr poder lograr sus objetivo hojala que sean muchas las familias que puedan salir adelante mediante la oportunidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Julio, 47 years old, is a man who has since his youth worked in the countryside, sometimes as a farmer, other times as a mason, to earn his family's daily bread. Julio is married and he and his wife have three grown children. For lack of work, Julio had to immigrate to a neighboring country, Costa Rica, to survive. Then he worked six years before collecting enough money to enable him to buy lands to cultivate. At present, he is working in Villa el Carmen as a garbage collector but he still works the land.

His loan request from AFODENIC is to buy enough land to reach 8.75 acres, which he will then begin to cultivate in order to dedicate himself to his own business and achieve independence. He feels very satisfied to be able to reach his objective, and hopes that many other families can also get ahead by having the opportunity for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY LAND IN ORDER TO HAVE HIS OWN BUSINESS

loans.name: Jania Valeria

texts.es: La joven Jania M. de 25 años de edad, es una joven esforzada que a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con su matrimonió como con sus estudios, tiene una niña de 4 años, que ayuda cuidar su mama ya que ella trabaja en la alcaldía  como responsable de los derechos de la niñez, su esposo es cadete de taxi, y junto han logrado hacer su casa. Con este préstamo que esta haciendo es para terminar de pagar sus estudios ya que es su último año en la carrera de Administración turística y hotelera y son muchos gastos gracias a la ayuda de su esposo y ahorro ha logrado poder cubrir los gastos, también va hacer una pequeña remodelación de su pequeña casa. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible hacer los trámites.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer mejoras a su casa y pagar  parte en sus estudios

loans.name: Jarol Ronne

texts.es: El joven Jarrol de 20 años de edad, reside junto con sus padres en Villa del Carmen de la alcaldía 2 c al lago, soltero. Se desempeña en servicios de seguridad para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Termino la secundaria pero por falta de recursos económicos no ha entrado a  estudiar una carrera técnica oh la universidad, lo cual espera hacerlo mas adelante. Con este préstamo va hacer mejoras a su casa para lograr estar cómodo e ir poco a poco construyendo. Esta contento por que es un comienzo en su vida el poder trabajar y poder apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Young Jarol, 20 years old, is single and lives with his parents in Villa del Carmen, two blocks from Lake Managua. He works in security services and helps his parents with household expenses. Jarol finished secondary school but a lack of economic resources has prevented him from studying in the university for a technical career, which he hopes to do later on.

With this loan Jarol intends to make improvements to their house, to make it more comfortable; to go on, little by little, building it. He is very pleased to be able to work and to help his parents, which represents a new beginning in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS IN HIS FAMILY'S HOUSE

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de 22 y 10 años de edad en el centro poblado Saltur, en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de cinco años ella maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de comida al paso; todas las tardes ,a las cuatro en punto, sale con su mesa a vender champús (una bebida hecha a base de maíz) y sánguches a una esquina cercana al lugar en donde vive; los productos que vende son muy solicitados por los vecinos del lugar que rápidamente consumen todo lo preparado para el día.

Su esposo es ayudante en el camal del lugar y con lo que ganan tratan de sacar adelante a su familia, pero esto no es suficiente para solventar sus gastos económicos así que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a nuestra institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa utilizar en la compra de un carrito sanguchero para ampliar sus negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y así sostener mejor la economía de su hogar.

Ella desea brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y poder brindarle algún tipo de estudio superior, en Saltur, ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos los cuales la toman por una mujer responsable y activa.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children (ages 22 and 10) in the central village of Saltur in the district of Zaña, located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 5 years, she has managed a small business selling fast food. Every afternoon around 4pm, she sells champús (a beverage made from corn) and sandwiches from her corner stand located near her home. Her products are frequently requested by the locals every day and are consumed rapidly as soon as she prepares them.

Her husband works in a slaughterhouse as an assistant and tries to support his family with his income, but it is not enough to cover all of their expenses. For this reason, María is seeking her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 500 soles. She plans to purchase a food cart so that she can expand her business by selling hamburgers and earn more money to sustain her household.

María wants to give her children a better quality of life and provide them the opportunity to pursue higher education in Saltur. She is loved and respected by her neighbors and considered to be a responsible and industrious woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a food cart for selling hamburgers

loans.name: Jose Leonidad

texts.es: El joven José Leonidas R. de 24 años de edad, soltero reside junto a sus padres en Villa el Carmen, el se desempeña como operador de computadora en la alcaldía, se siente contento por poder ayudar a sus padres en estos momentos. Con este crédito hará un cuarto el cual comprar materiales de construcción y comenzar a construir. Sus planes a futuro es poder estudiar una carrera técnica y lograr un trabajo con mejores ingresos y menos peligroso, a si como poder formar su propia familia. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder hacer las mejoras a su vivienda y lograr tener más comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
The young, 24-year-old Jose R. Leonidas is unmarried and lives with his parents in Villa el Carmen. He works as a computer operator at City Hall and is happy to be able to help his parents at the moment. With this loan he will build a room for which he will buy construction materials and begin to build. His plans for the future are to be able to study a technical career and achieve having a job with a better income and less danger, as such to be able to form his own family. He thanks Afodenic for the opportunity to be able to make improvements to his home and to achieve having more comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: El joven Rolando A. de 25 años de edad, soltero, reside en Villa el carmen Carretera vieja a León, trabaja en la alcaldía como contador general, y vive junto con sus padres, anteriormente trabajaba en un negocio en cuenta por cobrar en medio tiempo, el ha mucho esfuerzo ha logrado estar estudiando y es su ultimo año en contabilidad. También en el terreno de sus padres comenzó a construir  su propia casa pero todavía no se ha pasado ya que le faltan muchos detalles, con este préstamo hará la cocina y poco a poco la terminara el cual espera lograrlo y poder establecerse con su propia familia. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando A. is 25, is single, and lives in Villa El Carmen. He travels to León and works in the mayor's office as a general accountant. He lives with his parents. Previously, he worked at a business in accounts receivable part time. He has worked very hard at school, and he is in his last year of his accounting program. He also has started to construct his own home on his parents' land, but he hasn't finished it yet because there are still many details to be completed. With this loan, he will construct the kitchen, and little by little, he will finish his house, where he hopes to establish his own family. He is thankful to the microfinance institution for giving him the opportunity to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to construct his kitchen.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio tiene 52 años, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva un año dedicándose al negocio de la venta de carne de pollo en el mercado del distrito de Pomalca, lugar ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, todos los días sale muy temprado de su casa a comprar los pollos para luego llevarlos a vender al mercado, la carne es de muy buena calidad por lo que termina su venta rápidamente.

Su meta es llegar a crear su propia granja y su propio camal para vender el pollo mas barato y también distribuirlo a los negocios cercanos, por lo pronto ha empezado por solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, que piensa utilizar en la compra de más pollo para ampliar su negocio.

Evelio es muy conocido por los pobladores de la zona que prefieren su producto y dan fe de su responsabilidad y honradez.
texts.en:
Evelio is 52 years old, married and lives with he wife and 18-year-old son in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year he has been in business selling chicken in the market in the district of Pomalca, located 15 minutes from Chiclay. Each day he leaves his house early to buy chicken, which he takes to sell in the market. The meat is of good quality and sells out quickly. His goal is to build his own farm so that he can sell the chicken more cheaply and also to distribute to the area businesses. For now, he will start by asking, for the first time, for a loan from our institution which he plans to use to buy more chicken so that he can expand his business. Evelio is well-known among the area´s residents, who prefer buying his products and vouch for his honesty and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken to sell.

loans.name: Claudio Mauricio

texts.es: EL Joven Claudio L. de 21años de edad, reside en Villa el Carmen carretera vieja a León, soltero y vive junto con sus padres, trabaja en servicios de seguridad,  anteriormente de albañil para poder ganar el pan de cada día. Con suerte logro encontrar un trabajo fijo para. Con este préstamo hará mejoras a su vivienda y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando ya que por falta de recursos económico no ha seguido estudiando. Muy agradecido ya que con este oportunidad del préstamo podrá tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Young 21-year-old Claudio L. lives in Villa el Carmen, along the old highway to León. He is single and lives with his parents. He works for a security service company, and before that as a handyman, to earn money. Luckily he was able to find a steady job. With this loan he will make some home improvements and be able to have better living conditions. His plans are to be able to study, since due to lack of money he could not keep studying. He is very grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides to be able to have a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mauricio Jovanis

texts.es: El señor Mauricio F. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el municipio de villa del carmen del departamento de Managua, soltero, con casa propia, sus planes son mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, de profesión electricista y  trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del carmen desempeñándose en el aria de asistente de mantenimiento desde hace seis meses. Ha tenido falta de financiamiento para mejora su casa. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, zinc, piso. Su objetivo es obtener seguridad y protección a su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras de su vivienda ya que en día solo se puede construir mediante financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mauricio F. is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of Villa del Carmen, in the department of Managua. He is single and has his own house. His plans are to make improvements to the structure of his house. He is an electrician and for the past six months has worked in the mayor´s office in Villa del Carmen as a maintenance assistant. He has not had any money to pay for home improvements. Thanks to this loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc and flooring. His goal is to provide security and protection to his family. He thanks the institution for making it possible to make improvements to his house, as the only way to build is with financing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for making home improvements.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 4 hijos en el distrito de Mosefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Todos los días se levanta muy temprano y viaja hacia el terminal pesquero de ECOPHINSA, en el distrito de Santa Rosa a 10 minutos de donde ella vive, ahí compra diversas variedades de pescado fresco para luego venderlas en el mercado del distrito de Pomalca.

Ella lleva ya 18 años en este negocio y gracias a ello ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, ahora ella desea brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera técnica, por lo que está pensando en ampliar su pequeño puesto en el mercado con la compra de más pescado para vender a sus clientes.

Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su propósito, ella es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora y es muy conocida y estimada por sus compañeros del mercado donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old, a single mother and lives with her 4 children in the district of Mosefú, located 20 minutes from Chiclayo. Every day she gets up very early and goes to the fish warehouse in Ecophinsa, in the district of Santa Rosa, 10 minutes from where she lives. There she buys a variety of fresh fish to later sell in the market in the district of Pomalca. She has been in this business for 18 years and thanks to this has been able to raise her children. Now she would like to give them the opportunity to study a technical career, and is thinking of expanding her small stand in the market by buying more fish to sell to her customers. This is why she has, for the first time, asked for a loan from our institution to help her reach her goal. She is very responsible and hard-working and is well-known and respected by others in the market where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora, tiene 51años y vive sola en un cuarto alquilado, donde también implementó su tienda de licores. Son 20 años los que han pasado desde que Ana dejó su querida Madre de Dios (departamento peruano límite con Brasil) y cuando llegó a la ciudad de Juliaca, se propuso salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo. Ahora cuenta con una tienda de licores, la cual le genera buenos ingresos, ya que es muy concurrida, debido a la alegría que le pone al momento de vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, lleva 16 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que despertarse a altas horas de la noche para atender a sus clientes, ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy buena. Espera con el tiempo tener el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el quinto préstamo de Ana con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos no ha tenido problemas con los pagos. Ella es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y les transmite a todas esa alegría a sus compañeros. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más licores para implementar el stock de su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 24 años, es un joven tranquilo y trabajador, vive en la casa de su madre, a quien desea darle una vida mejor. Su trabajo es el tejido artesanal, con la ayuda de su madre realiza hermosos trabajos, para luego llevarlos a vender a su pequeño puesto en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Aunque todavía es muy joven, sabe que tiene una responsabilidad con su madre y es por eso que trabaja sin descanso. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a aun si son artesanías, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda mejor ubicada y vender con mayor comodidad sus artesanías. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, Edgar nunca ha tenido problemas en sus pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre es muy puntual y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para aumentar su producción y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edgar is 24 years old and is a peaceful and hard-working youth. He lives with his mother, to whom he would like to provide a better life. His is a weaver and, with his mother´s help, does beautiful work, which he later takes to sell at his small stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Although he is still young, he knows that he has to take care of his mother and this is why he works tirelessly. What is likes most about his work is to weave, more so if the weavings are crafts. He has been in business for 3 years and feels that the most difficult part is transporting the weavings to their point of sale, although he knows that this is his job and he has to do it. In the future he hopes to have a store with a better location so he can sell his goods in more comfortable surroundings. This is his fourth loan with MFP. Edgar has never had problems with his payments, he saves so that he can make payments on time. He is well-liked at his communal bank because he is always punctual and responsible. With the money requested he will buy more wool to increase his production and thus improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 34 años, es una mujer soltera muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de anticuchos (brochetas), los cuales prepara desde la tarde para venderlos llegada las 7 de la noche. Sus ventas son en la calle, de forma ambulante y cuando empieza a vender sus platillos, su carretilla se llena y es muy concurrida, ya que sus clientes saben que Elba tiene una sazón muy especial para cocinar los anticuchos, ya sean de carne de pollo o salchicha, todo depende del gusto del cliente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y atenderlos de la mejor manera, lleva 6 meses en esta actividad, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de artesanías, negocio que dejó de lado por un tiempo por su baja demanda. Elba considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que quedarse vendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche y para el futuro espera retomar su negocio de las artesanías, ya que con ese ingreso económico desea poner una tienda más grande de anticuchos donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. 
Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede y tiene buenos antecedentes en MFP de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, y eso lo saben bien los miembros de su banco comunal, es por ese motivo que confían en ella. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una nueva parrilla para los anticuchos, además cambiará las llantas de su triciclo porque ya están gastadas

loans.use: Compra de una nueva parrilla

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 34 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso; vive con su esposa Silvia de 24 años y sus dos pequeños niños, Rosemary de 5 años y Juan de tan solo 9 meses, y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. Su actividad es el transporte de pasajeros, es por eso que Esteban pasa sus días en busca de clientes que deseen abordar su motocarro, Él despierta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando, con el único fin de llevar un buen dinero a su hogar, ya que es consiente que su familia lo necesita y tiene que velar por su tranquilidad.
